name: Amy Bornstein
text:
I am a Artist, once a canvas has sold, it must be crated and shipped. The Owner by the name of Angeline and her staff are very helpful, patient, quick and very professional.
I will be using them constantly from now on.
It’s peace of mind to know that my artwork will travel to its new home and arrive in perfect condition.
Thank you, MailPro!!👩‍🎨

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! Always a pleasure to help our artists get their gorgeous art to where it's going!

name: Missy Fantusi
text: Nice greeting cards, last time I was there, I was waited on right away. That's great!!

name: Marsha Reynolds
text: Most convenient mailing store I have ever been to. I am never going back to the post office. The service at MailPro is outstanding and the staff is extremely helpful and lovely. Will definitely be back again and again.

resp.text: Ooooh thank you for the 5 stars! And thank you for letting us help you! Always a pleasure to be of service to sweet folks like you!

name: Steve Middlebrooks
text: I went in to ship a golf club today at Mail pro in Owens crossroads Alabama. There was a lady in front of me that went in no mask on and the lady at the counter told her just to put her package over there. I came in with no mask on she told me to go back out and get a mask! Does she know the time it takes for Covid-19 to spread is it a short time or a long time? Apparently she works for the CDC and she knows all about it to discriminate against who wears a mask and who does not. If that service wasn't bad enough they charged me $51 to ship a golf club which normally would cost $39 anywhere else. Save your money save your time and save your humiliation Don't go here.

resp.text:
Wow. Yes, two customers in a row walked right past our “masks required” sign that is posted on the door. The lady ahead of you could drop her prepaid off and go, you needed to be in the store longer. It would have been futile for her leave to get her mask and come back in - her task was complete.

I’m sorry you feel humiliated by being asked to be compassionate to those around us that haven’t had their vaccination yet. We are still trying to follow the current CDC guidelines, they are on the CDC website if you need a refresher.

And again, I’m sorry you felt the price to pack and ship your golf club was more than you wanted to pay. Generally the price for clubs to be packed and shipped runs between $25-$35. The weight, dimensions and destination for this particular package determined the options we gave you. We would have gladly handed it back to you if you had wanted, so you could “price shop” and maybe find an option that better suited your price range.

As always, you are welcome in our store in the future provided you can be considerate and compassionate to the other shoppers.

name: Kim Ringenbach (looneypumpkin)
text: Mail Pro is the best place to ship from in Huntsville! The staff is super friendly and quick! I've never had an issue and the owner is the best!

name: Garel 2008
text:
My wife sent an international mail to the Philippines with very important papers and very expensive. She had the wrong address on the package. She found out when she returned home, called them and they went through all the outgoing mail and found it and changed the address label in time. Great job! We will use MailPro again and with a great level of confidence.

Thanks! MailPro

resp.text: Aw! Thank you for the great review! Always happy to help, glad to get a package where it's supposed to go! Thanks for coming to see us!

My employees live over the mountain and I made the decision to remain closed today at 6:30 this morning when the news was reporting that schools, redstone and colleges were closed.

text: Fantastic business! I have shipped dozens of packages through them. Everything from legal papers to expensive fragile music instruments, and they have packaged and shipped everything perfectly. Love how convenient they are.

name: Tee West
text: Would give minus 5 stars if possible. Owner very rude!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! A  package was processed couple months ago to Amazon from different person in store Today owner refused and said they DID NOT do the package before when in fact it was. Owner needs to learn how to actually run this store sufficiently. I'd been embarrassed to admit I was owner with that attitude. I just read your reply and trust me you were rude and have no intentions of ever doing service here again. That shows bad character on your part for reply such as that!!!!!!! What an arrogance!!!

resp.text:
LOL!! Yes, I had the audacity to disagree with you... I'm sorry, you are simply mistaken. You chose the Amazon QR code that clearly states on your return for you to take the QR to branded UPS Store for them to scan.

We are MailPro, a UPS Authorized Shipping Outlet and can take Amazon returns with a UPS label when you choose "UPS Dropoff", our scanners can't scan UPS Store QR codes.

Last time I'm sure we showed you how to cancel your return, and re-return it as a "UPS Dropoff" to process it for you. We do this approximately 20 times a day for all of our fabulous customers.

I tried to show you how change your return but you were not receptive, choosing instead to be offended. Next time when you bring your QR code in - we'll be sure to walk you through each step so you can understand the process. Life is too short to go through it looking to be offended..

text: Great service and convenient location for mailing packages and returns to Amazon.

resp.text: Aw thanks! It's a pleasure to help!

text: Fast, friendly, helpful - LOVE MailPro! I always bypass the Post Office for the ease and convenience of this local mailing center. They are the nicest and can't beat their amazing service!

name: Lacey House

I Definitely recommend this business for all your shipping, binding, and packaging needs! Their location is also very convenient! Thanks MailPro!

resp.text: Thank you! Your business is very much appreciated and please come again soon!

name: Richard McCollum
text: They lost a FedEx package we sent. It has been a huge inconvenience for lots of people (and will continue to be for awhile). MailPro claims FedEx lost the package, but FedEx never scanned the package saying they picked it up, which leads me to believe MailPro lost it. FedEx claims MailPro lost it. Either way I really don't care, huge pain, never using the company again even though they are convenient.

resp.text: We are terribly sorry for your inconvenience. Your package did get picked up by FedEx, and we do have the manifest that the driver signed. It is rare that a package doesn't get scanned at the hub, but it does happen. We are sorry it happened to your package. All we can do is reimburse you for your shipping charge, which we have done.

name: Rebecca Jensen
text:
I was in Mailpro yesterday. The lady with dark hair and bigger was ugly to me in front of customers. I was there before the lady she was waiting on and asked her a question. That’s when she got mad and said she was waiting on someone else. I then said that I was there first and she went off on me even pointing out that I had crossed the line when I parked. She gave me the email I needed to send my package with and really though t I would send package thru her after her behavior. I paid 11 cents and left. I will never go in that horrible store again.

Your negative reply truly reflects the attitude you had toward me. Most reputable businesses try to correct the problem or apologize. They do not retaliate or make snarky comments.

resp.text:
Every customer is important and appreciated in our store. But we do expect our customers to act with basic manners learned in kindergarten. You did enter the store first and began your Wayfair return on your phone at the counter. While you were being helped by Wayfair I began helping a customer that came in and was ready.

You interrupted this transaction to tell me to look for the Wayfair email. I explained to you that I was helping another customer and I would help you as soon as her transaction was completed. You said "But I was here first!" And I replied "But you weren't ready." I was not unkind to you, I was not rude. I also mentioned that had parked diagonally in two spaces - to which you replied "I've got a new car..." Wow.

I see you have sent four packages through us in the last two years. If you want to take you business elsewhere, that's your choice. Of course, you are still welcome continue to drop off your prepaid returns with us in the future.

name: Robert Lee
text: I'm literally in here all the time shipping random items or sending certified mail. The service is always great. Thanks for being awesome! I'm sure I'll see you sometime today to ship something else!

resp.text: Thank you! We strive to be of service, and appreciate your business!

name: CurlyCutie
text: My daughter and I just experienced the most horrendous display of racism and bigotry from the "owner" of this location that I have yet to encounter in this area.  I own a small business that I run out of my home in McMullen Cove (and yes, I do have a license with the City of Huntsville).  I mail packages on a daily basis.  Today, I missed my mail pick up and our local post office had already closed so we drove down to this store so that we could ensure our packages would go out today.  My 12 year old went in first and was refused service.  So, I then took the packages and went inside only to be told that, "I don't receive anything from the Post Office for compensation and am not required to provide service to you."   I asked for her to put that in writing, she refused, spewed some other nastiness until 2 other individuals came in and I told her I would be reporting her to the proper authorities and I left.   As I type this, I am still shaken, that this kind of bigotry and hatred can still exist.  That people feel they have the right to treat others with such vile.  I will not be returning to this location ever and would strongly urge others to also find somewhere else to spend your hard earned money.

resp.text: Wow, I feel I have to respond to this - this goes beyond misleading and is simply a lie. There were others in the store that were witness to your extremely rude, and bullying behavior Saturday afternoon. I'm so sorry that we couldn't help you, and that you were not happy here. We really try hard to make every customers experience here a very good one. As I explained to you when you were here - your postal labels would not scan. I tried on both registers  - your labels were not clear enough to be scanned. You knew they were poor labels beforehand, because you were quick to *demand* that I type the numbers in and give you a receipt. I explained that we do not do this, as the post office may never scan and relabel them and we would be held responsible for shipments not delivered as the location that accepted them. I never refused to scan your items, I scanned them several times. I did refuse to give you a receipt for items that won't scan. Again, I'm sorry that you are not happy, but please don't make a racial issue out of a situation that race simply had no bearing. That is extremely sad. I do hope you find happiness wherever you find to drop off in the future.

text: Went for help with a difficult Amazon return, & the very helpful staff worked with me to return the packages with no charge! Angeline was especially kind. Will be returning.

name: Joshua Magrath
text: This place is over priced and lost their DHL access. In short the employee went through my package nosing around asking inappropriate questions. I have used them many times and always found this place over priced and unprofessional.

resp.text:
Mr. Magrath, I’m sorry you felt unhappy with the quality of our service. Our records indicate that you’ve shipped two packages with us in as many years. One internationally, yes - we must ask questions about your shipment. “What are you sending? What is the value?” The details are required, not by us - but by international customs. We would absolutely not ask any “inappropriate” questions.

Last week you came in and wanted to ship a box of “parts” and insure it. Yes, again, we need to know what you are sending and how much it’s worth. Not out of curiosity, but for insurance purposes. Again, not inappropriate questions. You were very vague about what it was - turned out to be paintball gun equipment, once we ascertained that it wasn’t firearm parts (we aren't licensed to send firearms or HAZMAT) and had no compressed cartridges included (HAZMAT) - we shipped it for you.

You seemed fine with the transaction at the time - I wish you had had the courage to complain in person instead of leaving a fully misleading review. Some people take these reviews seriously. Truth is, unhappy people write reviews, happy people come back (our customer count is up 30% since we bought the store in October) and we will continue to help our absolutely wonderful customers do what they are trying to do.

Our staff has over 20 years collective experience in the packing and shipping industry. When you bring your items to us to ship, part of our service is ensuring that your item will make it to its destination in perfect shape. Sorry if you find this expertise “nosey”. Lol!

We are a DHL authorized shipping center, and we do accept pre-labeled DHL shipments at our location. We just don’t have enough demand for the service to print labels from our account.

Last week you came in and wanted to ship a box of “parts” and insure it. Yes, again, we need to know what you are sending and how much it’s worth. Not out of curiosity, but for insurance purposes. Again, not inappropriate questions. You were very vague about what it was - turned out to be paintball gun equipment, once we ascertained that it wasn’t firearm parts (we aren't licensed to send firearms or HAZMAT) and had no compressed cartridges included (HAZMAT) - we shipped it for you.

You seemed fine with the transaction at the time - I wish you had had the courage to complain in person instead of leaving a fully misleading review. Some people take these reviews seriously. Truth is, unhappy people write reviews, happy people come back (our customer count is up 30% since we bought the store in October) and we will continue to help our absolutely wonderful customers do what they are trying to do.

Our staff has over 20 years collective experience in the packing and shipping industry. When you bring your items to us to ship, part of our service is ensuring that your item will make it to its destination in perfect shape. Sorry if you find this expertise “nosey”. Lol!

We are a DHL authorized shipping center, and we do accept pre-labeled DHL shipments at our location. We just don’t have enough demand for the service to print labels from our account.

I tried on both registers  - your labels were not clear enough to be scanned. You knew they were poor labels beforehand, because you were quick to *demand* that I type the numbers in and give you a receipt. I explained that we do not do this, as the post office may never scan and relabel them and we would be held responsible for shipments not delivered as the location that accepted them. I never refused to scan your items, I scanned them several times. I did refuse to give you a receipt for items that won't scan. Again, I'm sorry that you are not happy, but please don't make a racial issue out of a situation that race simply had no bearing. That is extremely sad. I do hope you find happiness wherever you find to drop off in the future.

There were others in the store that were witness to your extremely rude, and bullying behavior Saturday afternoon. I'm so sorry that we couldn't help you, and that you were not happy here. We really try hard to make every customers experience here a very good one. As I explained to you when you were here - your postal labels would not scan. I tried on both registers  - your labels were not clear enough to be scanned. You knew they were poor labels beforehand, because you were quick to *demand* that I type the numbers in and give you a receipt. I explained that we do not do this, as the post office may never scan and relabel them and we would be held responsible for shipments not delivered as the location that accepted them. I never refused to scan your items, I scanned them several times. I did refuse to give you a receipt for items that won't scan. Again, I'm sorry that you are not happy, but please don't make a racial issue out of a situation that race simply had no bearing. That is extremely sad. I do hope you find happiness wherever you find to drop off in the future.

name: Judy Malone
text: I'm in this store at least 3 times a week for something - they help me with everything. The Cove is lucky to have this little store, the workers are always knowledgeable, efficient, and cheerful. Thanks y'all! A+++++

resp.text: Thank you Judy! We love to make our customers happy.

name: Gaybrielle Valverde
text: I love how convenient this place is and I’ve never had a negative experience at this store.

resp.text: Well, the sweet people in this area, like you, make our job easy! Thank you so much for your kind review!

name: Marie Channer
text: LOVE! this store!  They are the go to place for my shipping.  They even mailed a grandfather clock....no problem they said.  Thank you MailPro!!!

resp.text: I remember the clock! Thank you for your business and the packing challenge!

name: chris anderson
text: The overall atmosphere isnt the same ,   I got some bad looks when I dropped off a return since I was only using the drop box and not paying to return through them

resp.text: I'm sorry to hear you feel this way. May I ask what we can do to improve your experience or correct the problem?

name: Britton Ethridge
text: Went for help with a difficult Amazon return, & the very helpful staff worked with me to return the packages with no charge! Angeline was especially kind. Will be returning.

name: Joshua Magrath
text: This place is over priced and lost their DHL access. In short the employee went through my package nosing around asking inappropriate questions. I have used them many times and always found this place over priced and unprofessional.

resp.text:
Mr. Magrath, I’m sorry you felt unhappy with the quality of our service. Our records indicate that you’ve shipped two packages with us in as many years. One internationally, yes - we must ask questions about your shipment. “What are you sending? What is the value?” The details are required, not by us - but by international customs. We would absolutely not ask any “inappropriate” questions.

Last week you came in and wanted to ship a box of “parts” and insure it. Yes, again, we need to know what you are sending and how much it’s worth. Not out of curiosity, but for insurance purposes. Again, not inappropriate questions. You were very vague about what it was - turned out to be paintball gun equipment, once we ascertained that it wasn’t firearm parts (we aren't licensed to send firearms or HAZMAT) and had no compressed cartridges included (HAZMAT) - we shipped it for you.

You seemed fine with the transaction at the time - I wish you had had the courage to complain in person instead of leaving a fully misleading review. Some people take these reviews seriously. Truth is, unhappy people write reviews, happy people come back (our customer count is up 30% since we bought the store in October) and we will continue to help our absolutely wonderful customers do what they are trying to do.

Our staff has over 20 years collective experience in the packing and shipping industry. When you bring your items to us to ship, part of our service is ensuring that your item will make it to its destination in perfect shape. Sorry if you find this expertise “nosey”. Lol!

We are a DHL authorized shipping center, and we do accept pre-labeled DHL shipments at our location. We just don’t have enough demand for the service to print labels from our account.

name: Wes Haley
text: MailPro is the place to go when I need to ship a package. But it's also great for so many other things - notary services, live fingerprinting, moving supplies, copies, print jobs, etc.  - basically it's a one stop shop - convenient, courteous owners and employees, and fair prices.

name: Brandon Stapler
text: Awesome folks

name: Pat Carpenter
text: Very convient. . Good service. Everything you need for mailing in one place.

name: Steve Vaughan
text: They are very expensive.

resp.text: We don't have you in our records as a customer... Wrong store? Our prices are competitive with all the other pack and ship stores.

name: Michael
text: Good service. Quick.

name: Michele F
text: We have never had anything but EXCELLENT service at this location

name: David Farley
text: Great staff, fast service.

resp.text: Thank you! We love to make our customers happy.

name: Tns Wiley
text: Wonderful speedy service!

resp.text: Thank you for coming in to see us!

name: Michael Jones
text: Amazing people!

name: Vannessa Brown
text: Brad and his company (Protec Recycling) were very respectable, responsive and professional.  They provided exceptional service.  Their promptness and thoroughness are greatly appreciated.

resp.text: Thanks for the review!

name: Jason Summer
text:
Arbitrarily charges arbitrary fees for pickup at the store.

The service, initially, was fine.  I had searched as best as I could online to determine if UPS had a main warehouse in the area to which I could have a package delivered.  I kept getting redirected to the local UPS stores, like this one.  I even called the UPS customer service line to find out if there was a local warehouse, and was placed on hold for 30 mins before I gave up.  I then checked for a local UPS store (again, including this location), went to the location’s website, copied the address, and used it for shipping.

***At no point was there any indication from the primary UPS website or this local UPS store website that any charges may be incurred for using the address for shipping***

So, as the clerk brought my box to me, they stated there would be a $5 charge.  Surprised, I asked why and was told it was because I used their location as a shipping address.  I was also informed by the clerk the location was not an “actual” UPS location, so there were extra fees that may be incurred. I said I understood, and asked they show me any literature that indicated there was a charge for using the location for my shipping.  They could not produce any literature, documentation, or point out anywhere on their website that this particular service would incur a fee.  However, the clerk did advise if I had simply called the store ahead of time to ask about shipping, they would’ve informed me about the charge.

In this day and age, who calls for quick info unless it’s a last resort? And why aren’t these charges posted on UPS corporate site or on the local store’s site?  Where’s the transparency?

I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt - I stepped out of line so they could assist other customers and I searched online on my phone for any indication of a charge for this service and found none.  So, really folks, this store - based on their logic - could hold your package ransom for whatever amount they want: $5, $15, $20?  The charge is not posted anywhere, they have your shipment, and won’t release it until you pay.

After a fun back-and-forth between me and the manager (?), she finally, out of the “goodness of her heart” (she essentially spat those words out at me), allowed me to take my shipment without charging me.  She also made certain she made some serious notes near my pick-up signature for her future reference.  Finally, as I was leaving, she made one of those passive-aggressive comments to her colleague, but loud enough to be certain I heard it, something to the extent of: “all of this over $5?!”  I responded, “Yes. Over $5.”  There have been many times when $5 made or broke my week.

I completely understand and support a business’s right to charge whatever they want for whatever products or services. However, we should not be ransomed into paying some arbitrary, unpublished, hidden charge that we are surprised with at the counter before we can pick up a package. This is the digital age - there is no reason that charge can’t be easily - and prominently - be listed on their website.  Or even printed on one of their many signs behind the counter, or even on a menu of costs/services that they can hand the customer.  Where is the transparency??  But there was nothing other than the word of the clerk.  In this day and age, and in a business that aligns itself with such a large delivery corporation, that lack of information is egregious, especially due to how easy of a fix it is - just update the damned website.

name: KMAC
text: There are quite a lot of services offered here most might not be aware of BEYOND shipping a package.  There are PO Boxes, fingerprinting services, shipping, copying, faxing & Amazon return services to name a few. I wouldn't say  they are the friendliest group of ladies, but they ARE efficient,  knowledgeable, strong and quick!

name: Jayla Jayden
text: Ups is awful all of my packages are coming opened or broken!!!! I took a picture but idk how to add it. I have tried to contact a manager but everytime I call they tell me someone will contact me about my problem but never does 🤬

name: J. D. T.
text: These people spend far more time talking than they do working. I have spent 20 minutes in line and not one not see one person leave. It's ridiculous. Dropping off a package that should take 2 minutes can easily take 30 minutes. Get some people in here who understand customer service. The last thing I want to do in a pandemic is unnecessarily stand in line in a small room!

name: Andrea Brown
text: Excellent Service and products! Very professional service!

name: Juliana Hunt
text:
I am glad to see I am not the only one who keeps experiencing rude employees and horrible customer service. I have tried to use this location multiple times over the years. This location is close to where I live which is why I continued to go back.

Every time I go, staff is extremely rude. Even before COVID-19, this location was just plain awful. This past week was the final straw with being snapped at by employees. I had two returns to ship and had already packaged and labeled them. Literally made this process easy for them and they still managed to be nasty.

I will use the UPS on County Line Road or the one in Athens from now on and never ever go back to this one. I have had wonderful experiences at those two locations.

name: Holly Merryman
text: I read several of the 1 star reviews and realized I'm not the only one that experienced the short tempered staff that blames customers for inconvenience and are completely unwilling to help.  A surprise from a store that relies heavily on walk in customers.   A smile and a good attitude go a long way.  I wasn't the subject of complaint by said employee, but got to hear a full 15 minute rant about a previous customer that obviously only needed a little instruction. Everyone seemed to feel uncomfortable. Also, the first time I took my Amazon returns in this store, the employee was happy I had a box. She said, "Good, now I don't have to use one of mine." The next time, she dumped the contents of my box and rudely handed it to me and said. We don't need your box." Frustrating to say the least. I only continue to go here because it is conveniently located.

name: Dallas R. Wheeler
text: This place is awesome! The staff are always friendly and the service is great!

name: Jessica Babcock
text: I really liked this UPS.   They have everything you could possibly need for shipping.  You can always leave your items there and they will carefully pack and ship everything.  Located in a great spot if you need to do some errands too.

name: GINA CUMMINGS
text: The manager, Marcy, and her team are so helpful and efficient!!! Tonight Marcy reassured my nerves with shipping a large dollar item to a customer off EBay. She was so detailed with making sure the items were properly packaged and safeguarded. I will definitely use this location again! Outstanding service!!

name: Cahil Quirk
text: I have a mail box here and it is so convenient, 24/7 access and they receive my packages so I don't have worry. When I visit during regular business hours I always receive a friendly greeting and prompt service. Great group of people. Thanks

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! We strive to provide the best customer experience possible. : )

name: Fernando Escalante
text: Horrible service. The older skinny lady with short hair could work on her attitude.  The other two chubby employees were rude and nosey. I walked in for a service I was not aware I needed an appointment for. They all three started talking to me at one. I didn’t know who I was talking to. Felt like I was being kicked out. They kept telling me I needed to come back later once I had an appointment. I heard it the first time from each of you. Chill! Quit acting like you own the damn place!

name: Ellen George
text: Service is slow, even slower than the University Drive location. Definitely don't go here if you are on a time crunch because you will waste a lot of time just standing around waiting for the customers ahead of you. One bright side is this location does usually have 2 employees working the register. I came here for notary services and paid $10 for one document.

resp.text: Hello :) We do apologize there was a higher-than-normal volume of customers in our store today.  We were quite busy today since another UPS Store location was having technical difficulties and was closed. We take pride in serving each customer fairly and until their needs are met :) . We are happy we were able to complete your notary successfully today. We do charge for our notary service ($5 notoral act, $5 clerical fee), and disclose the price for the notary before we continue with the process. Please come see us again!

name: Peter Tiffany
text: The manager and staff are always courteous and helpful and have a smile ready for you.  They were very flexible about me being able to pick up some lingering mail beyond my PO box cancellation date also, which was very much appreciated.  Great experience overall.

resp.text: Thank you for your review.  We appreciate your kind words.

name: ez Zerrano
text: I am surprised there are negative reviews for this location. The people who work at this UPS store are all professional and friendly. I’ve been using their services for almost nine months now.

name: Dallas Wheeler
text: Fast and friendly staff! Very quick service considering how busy this store stays!

name: Bradley Owens
text: Excellent staff, they can ship anything from candy to furniture and even vehicle engines. They do it with a smile. I have also been able to take care of other things there as well. Printing, packaging and even have my packages held there safely when out of town.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words :)

name: Michelle Riley
text: Needed Cogent Scan fingerprinting completed. I called ahead to make sure I could get it done and was told "yes". I arrived and Laurie/Lori took care of me. She was professional, confident, and knowledgeable.  Scanning prints isn't as easy as you might think.  I relaxed and let her do her thing and I was in and out quickly.  Come here for your fingerprints. They know what they're doing!

resp.text: Michelle, Thank you for your review and allowing The UPS Store to serve you. We look forward to assisting you again.

name: Crystal Bergeron
text:
Customer service is pretty lacking here. I came to this location with multiple packages today and was initially relieved to see I was the only customer there when I first walked in. This was my first experience with returning some items from amazon where UPS will package and label the items for you and I was hoping for some guidance. Instead, the girl accepting my items just stood there looking annoyed as I fumbled through my phone to try and locate the barcodes she needed and trying to match them to the correct items. I apologized multiple times and explained that this was my first time returning this way, but there was zero attempt by her to even try to help make this uncomfortable process quicker or easier for either of us.
I also had an expensive lens that I rented and was returning. I had it already packed up in the box, which closed on its own, but still needed tape to ensure it didn’t come open in shipping. I mentioned this to her (I was more than willing to buy tape, if needed), but she just scanned the box in and put it to the side without a word. I mentioned again before leaving that I really needed to tape up the box before shipping and she unenthusiastically said that she would do it, but I did not leave this location with the warm and fuzzies that my package will make it safely to its destination. Hopefully she actually did tape it before shipping and I won’t be paying for damages. In the future, I will go somewhere that doesn’t make me feel like an inconvenience to the staff.

name: Mark Loper
text:
I took a single, one-sided document in to be scanned and put on a flash drive... $5.45!  Five dollars and 45 cents to scan a document to a flash drive??!!

To add insult to injury, the scan I got is unusable.  The original had some light shading which came out as completely black.  I should have read the reviews...

resp.text:
Hello, We apologize your experience did not go as planned in the store. We will be glad to give you a quote before we perform any service, just ask us = ) . That way you will know the price before we do the task for you. We do charge a fee for scanning the documents, emailing documents, faxing documents, and/or adding the files to storage devices..  If the quality of the documents are not coming out right, there could be a flaw in the original file you supplied. We would also be happy to address that for you and even make a correction to it.
We hope you will give us another chance in the future!

Thank you.

name: Dominick Risaliti
text: These reviews of this place must be old because the staff was extremely friendly and helped me fit my computer stand in as many combination of boxes and configurations they could to try to drop the price. And they did it all with a smile. Very happy I came here today.

resp.text:
Dominick,
Thank you for taking time out of your busy schedule to leave us a POSITIVE review. Please let us know if we could ever be of assistance again. :)

name: Jessica Mitchell
text: Delivered on the correct day but delivered package to the wrong house a street over. Luckily the people who recieved it were honest, good people and brought it to us.

resp.text:
Hello I apologize you this happened! Unfortunltely we are only a 3rd Party Retailer, meaning we do not have control over the UPS "Brown Truck". We are two seperate companies, but I understand where the confusion was because our names both have UPS in them. Sometimes we have customers leaving reviews by mistake to the wrong company. We understand mistakes happen :) . You can always contact UPS and file a complaint with them.

However, if this issue occurs, please call 1-800-742-5877, to speak with a UPS Rep. They can make sure this issue is corrected appropriately :). If you need any shipping or printing done, please come see us :)

Thank you.

name: Will Fuller
text: Needed a notary service and noticed the overall poor reviews of both UPS locations in this area. First off, I’m a see for myself kind of person and very understanding because I’ve worked customer service before. The lady that assisted me was very friendly and prompt. However, the lady behind her who seemed to be the manager was pitching a fit about someone’s packing skills, slamming tape and other items around...”I don’t know how they expect this to make it...” She was the one who initially accepted the package. If it wasn’t packed properly, it should’ve been addressed before accepted. Also, her inability to maintain professionalism in front of customers shows either a lack of self awareness or a disregard for customers in general. The lady assisting me stared with a look on her face like “I know this is an issue, but there’s nothing I can do about it.” I won’t be here again unless I have to.

resp.text:
Hello, we apologize you recieved a negative experience :(. We take pride in assisting all of our customers no matter how large or small the task is!. We hope you will give us another chance in the future :)

Thank you!

name: David Cooper
text: Very convenient location ... But the staff always seem to be interested in just making it to closing time ... Especially if you are just dropping off UPS box.(edited ... Dropped another star (2018) ... Same level of service.  Location is all they have that's is really good

resp.text: Thank you for your response.

name: Cara Nall
text:
This store doesn’t offer full notary services, so suggest you take documents elsewhere. They previously questioned notarizing an approval for a background investigation, and today declined to notarize a basic medical form. I was able to go elsewhere easily but was frustrated to waste a trip. The staff at this store was professional, but don’t waste a trip if you’re coming here only for notary services in case they won’t notarize your form either.

ETA: I appreciate the owners response below, but the staff at the time declined because of the document type. They were even kind enough to provide the card for a traveling notary I could contact to come to my home. I have documents notarized routinely and am well-versed in not completing or signing documents beforehand. Thank you!

resp.text:
Hello, We apologize this happened. There could have been an issue with your form that needed to be notorized. As a Notary Public, we see a lot of customers who sign and fill out documents before they meet with us. Unfortunately at that time, we are not able to notorize that document for that reason. We will be happy to notorize your next document :). Please call us to inquire about a notory services and the type of documents we do or do not notorize, at 256-464-3700. We do sometimes refer a mobile Nptary Public in instances like this :).

Thank you. We hope to serve you again!

name: Kathy Thomas
text: This UPS store is hands down is the most knowledgeable and nicest in Huntsville.  I go out of my way to use this location over others in town.  Thank you for great service time and time again!

resp.text: We appreciate you coming into the store! We are here for all your needs with a customer friendly environment. Hopefully, we can be the first choice for your shipping, packing, and printing needs! Thank you for sharing your experience with us!

name: Britt Crittenden
text: I came in flustered...I had printed out the wrong packing slip, my boxes were too big for my items, my youngest child was going crazy....I felt like I was being a horrible customer. The ladies up front made me feel anything but a bad customer. They showed me how to send them the correct info to print off, fixed my boxes for me, and had a play area for the kids. I will bring all of my shipping needs to this store from now on. They were so friendly and helpful. And for a stressed out mom, this is exactly what I needed. Thank you!!

resp.text:
We thank you for the kind words. Come see us again! :)

Thank you.

name: Richard Schuler
text: Dropped off an Amazon return.  Less than five minutes in and out.  Very friendly staff.

name: Andy Guyette
text:
Extremely Poor rating.
The owners and management are extremely bad. We had a package that never got delivered. When I went to ask what happened, they claimed it was delivered. A week later cards and checks that were in the package were returned to us. How can that be if they delivered the package. We asked for reimbursement and they avoided us like the plague. Two weeks later we received a check for less than a 1/3 of total value. They said take it or leave it. I do not know how they are staying in business. They have the worst Customer Service Attitude of any business I ever used. I will never use them again.

resp.text: Hello! As of April 2015 The UPS Store has undergone new ownership, and our staff is ready to serve you! Please stop by our location for all your packing, shipping, and printing needs. :)

name: Angela Smith
text: Always very prompt and professional service! They do a great job!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review. Please let us know if we could ever be of assistance again.

name: Kaitlyn MacIntyre
text: Avoid this location at all costs. Slow service, employees who don’t know what they’re doing, and they charged us $10 extra per package to mail flat rate boxes, and didn’t inform us of that until we had given them all information (which took forever) and were ready to pay.

resp.text: Hello, we do apologize that we did not meet your expectations that day. I was looking in our system, but have no record of you shipping at our location, there is a possibility you may have left this review for the incorrect location. Again we apologize, we may have been very busy that day and other customers ahead of you that needed assistance. In order to give you an accurate quote on shipping, we must get all of your info in order to get an accurate quote. We give all options available when the quote is complete. We also disclose to customers that ask about Priority Mail options. Our associates explain thorughly the difference in  Standard Priority Mail and Priority Flat Rate mail. We do not provide the "Flat Rate USPS" options since we are only a 3rd parts retailer. It is a federally protected and funded program that is only available at USPS Post Office locations. We hope you will give us another chance in the future for all your printing and shipping needs!

name: Kayla Riggs
text: Can NOT say enough nice things about this business. I drive from Decatur to this location because I can rely on friendly staff and guarantee that they appreciate my business. Never had any issues and my packages have always arrived on time.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words. We appreciate your business.

name: Suzan Von Hor
text: This place has undergone a transformation. The last owners were abysmal. I just went here recently as a final resort and was amazed at the difference. Thank you for such a pleasant experience. Wishing you every success.

resp.text: We appreciate you coming into the store! We are here for all your needs with a customer friendly environment. Hopefully, we can be the first choice for your shipping, packing, and printing needs! Thank you for sharing your experience with us!

name: Kristoffer Flaherty
text: They charge additional profit margins on top of the standard USPS price for stamps. They charged me 78 cents for a 34 cent postcard stamp. When I called then on it for charging the wrong price they said it was too late they had already affixed the stamp to my postcard. This was the last time I use this establishment.

resp.text: The UPS Store is a retail store and we to charge a convenience fee on all of our postal services. We're sorry for your experience as postal services are non-refundable.

name: Ashley Lewis
text: The store on Madison Blvd need serious Customer Service re-ramp!!!! I was not greeted upon entry of the store . I approached the kiosk and instead of addressing me to my face the employee at the desk called the person in the back to come help me . This store is rude and the employees are prejudice!

resp.text:
Thank you for your review. We apologize for your experience inside the store was not to positive. We take pride on serving all of our customers. Our associates may have been performing a time sensative transaction, and asked for another associate to step in to assist customers. We train all of our associates to highest standards at the UPS Store :). We hope you will give us another chance in the future.

Thank you.

name: John Lynch
text:
I have posted my last package from this store front, and will henceforth ship via FedEx: lying to a customer is never a good decision.
1. My fault - I forgot about a holiday. So to get a critical package delivery I paid a premium to ship 3-Day select.
2. UPS fault - the critical item was mis-sorted at the delivery location and re-routed from Maine back to Massachusetts thereby missing the critical delivery date by 4-days.
3. Madison Blvd UPS store helped me complete the UPS claim form for reimbursement of the failed shipment, informing me that UPS would send reimbursement to my home address. After waiting 6-weeks with no word, I inquired at the Madison Blvd store regarding status ...
4 UPS Store fault - I was informed that UPS denied the claim as it was not filed inside the 14-day claim window. I asked for a contact at UPS. After following through with a phone call to UPS, I was informed that a claim was never filed from the UPS store.

Bottom line: UPS caused the initial delivery failure due to a mis-sorting error, and failed to stand behind their product/service using "policy" over the customer.

The UPS Store on Madison Blvd compounded the failure by failing to submit the reimbursement claim, and then lying to me directly regarding the circumstance - also failing to stand behind their product/service.

Serendipity: I am finding the FedEx facility more helpful (adding extra tape when they think it would be helpful without charging be a package fee as I was subject to elsewhere ... Read UPS store. Also, I'm finding that FedEx shipping rates are as much as $10 cheaper than I had paid at the UPS store as some destinations included a "delivery surcharge."

Thank you, FedEx!!!

-----------------------
8/23/2016 Update

Regarding the letter mentioned in the reply by Lori (store owner) I asked for a copy of that before I posted my initial review and was told it was an internal document and was not permitted to view it. And it does not change the fact that UPS told me specifically that they did not receive a claim request.

So whether the fault lies with UPS or the UPS Store, I now ship FedEx.

resp.text: Mr. Lynch, Thank you for using The UPS Store Madison. I apologize that The UPS Store and UPS did not meet your expectations. The UPS Store Madison did file a Guaranteed Service Refund (GSR) on June 17, 2016 for you. The refund was denied on June 20, 2016 by UPS not The UPS Store Madison. The reason the GSR was denied is because refunds must be requested within 15 calendar days from the date the package was delivered. We at The UPS Store (a 3rd Party Retailer) challenged the decision by UPS and the claim was still denied. We have a copy of all the paper work if you would like to come by our location to look at it. Best Regards, Lori

name: Nancy Chenault
text: The manager has serious issues and shouldn’t be in a job working with the public. She obviously hates her job and complains non stop about Amazon and  having to “feeding the monster” , her words not mine.

resp.text:
Thank you for your review. We apologize for your experience inside the store. We do have to keep a close eye on our industrial copier we have so we don't run out of paper. We do call it the monster sometimes because of its size : ). We hope we can serve you again in the future!

Thank you.

name: Kristina Tucker
text: I consistently have packages that are "delivered" that don't arrive to my house until days later.

resp.text: Hello Kristina, We do apologize you have had issues with getting your packages delivered. Unfortunately, The UPS Store is a "3rd Party Retailer." Being said, our store is not responsible for operations of the "UPS brown truck." Another possibility you are experiencing is a UPS SurePost shipping method. The SurePost option allows UPS to "deliver" the package to your local area postal service, for them finish the delivery to your estate. Once UPS delivers the package to the Postal Service, you may still get a notification it has been "delivered". Unfortunately, that would only mean it was delivered to them. With that service, processing can sometimes take 2-3 days. That is the most common issue with that particular service, It is always best to verify with the shipper as to what shipping method they have used for your package. With that being said, The UPS Store can offer a guaranteed delivery date and time for packages that we send out of our store! If you would like more information, please give us a call or stop by. We look forward to seeing you!

name: Angela Graham
text:
This UPS Store is a joke. Employees are rude and unknowledgeable. The store is so messy, it should be condemned.

Avoid at all costs if you need anything more than a place to drop off packages.

resp.text:
Thank you for your review. We apologize for your experience inside the store. We may have been rather busy that day with other customers on top of training our new associates for the day. You may have came in on the day that our "Industrial Shippers" came in and we were packing their very heavy equipment. We tend to have several things going on at once when performing those tasks, but we always ensure a clean store for safety of our customers and employees. We hope we can serve you again soon! :)

Thank you.

name: James French
text: Staff a bit overwhelmed with customer visits.  Super nice.

resp.text:
Thank you for the review. Yes, we have been rather busy lately, but we are always happy to serve our customers any way we can : ).

Thank you!

name: Chanarda Murray
text: Customer Service is horrible! I had a booklet binded and the lady didn't take her time to do it correct. She punched the holes wrong and had the nerve to tell me she could make it work, which it it did not work. I went back to the store three times to get it done correctly, and the last time I was there she basically did NOT want to take responsibility for what she did wrong. The customer service is horrible and RUSHED! I will not be going back, I think three times is enough!

resp.text: The UPS Store staff sincerely apologizes, that you feel our customer service skills were not up to par. However, the young associate did admit to punching the holes wrong on Saturday, and tried to the best of her ability to correct the problem. She also told us that she became very nervous after punching the cover page of your book wrong, which may have lead you to believe she was in a hurry. She also told us that you came back a 2nd time on Saturday, because you thought the coil was not installed correctly and replaced the coil for you, even though she felt like there was nothing wrong with coil binding that she had done. You called on Monday morning to complain about your Church -Songs of Inspiration Book. The associate on the phone happily reprinted you a NEW Song Book (that you emailed to the store); rebound your book with a clear cover, blue back cover and a new coil bind at NO CHARGE. The associate on the phone did all of this without even seeing the book that was supposedly not correct. When you came in on Monday the NEW book was ready for you. We do realize that you encountered the same associate again on Monday when you came back into the store. We do wish that you would have asked for a manager to review the book that you felt was not correctly complete. We hope that you would give us another chance in the future.

name: David McCollum
text: Use this place a lot, always friendly and fast service

resp.text: Thank you for your review.  We appreciate your kind words.

name: Shanika Ogburn
text: Friendly staff and quick service.

resp.text: Thank you for your review.  We appreciate your kind words.

name: Alberto Bartolomei
text: The staff oriented me wrong about a shipping and gave me unlawful information.  Need better informed staff about shipping procedures. They only care about selling. I don't recommend this store to no one.

resp.text: We apologize for the inefficient knowledge you may have received when you came to visit the store. We have changed ownership of the store and have a new fully knowledgeable staff as of April 2015. We invite you to come and experience the new environment.  We want to make it easier to take care of your printing, packing, and shipping needs!

name: Paul Gerhart
text: Constantly changing staff that is missing sufficient training to accomplish simple tasks.

resp.text: We apologize for the service(s) you may have received at the time of your visit. We have completely changed ownership of the store, not just associates, and have a new fully trained staff as of April 2015. We invite you to come and experience the new environment.  We are dedicated to making it easier to fulfill your shipping, packing, and printing needs!

name: M&L Treasures
text: Just left this store after waiting 10 min to simply drop off a pkg that only required logging in and giving me a receipt. I will avoid this location in the future.

resp.text: I apologize that you had to wait in line for 10 minutes. We must have been rather busy that day.

name: Karin S
text: I avoid this location due to its bad service. I paid to ship a package overnight, Saturday delivery. When the recipient didn’t get the package I checked tracking and it wasn’t put on a truck even though I sent it before the pickup deadline. Then it was like pulling teeth to get my refund. Staff was rude and unhelpful.

resp.text:
Hello we are sorry this happened to you! We ensure that all of our packages leave the store daily with the drivers. We do a walkthrough with them. There could have been an issue with the UPS company in which your package could have been delayed. Us, beaing a pack and ship center, could have filed a claim with UPS for a delayed delivery and could have had UPS reimburse you for the loss. Unfortunately, I have looked through data and did not see that you had requested one :(. We hope to serve you again in the future :)

Thank you.

name: Antana Martinez
text: Before we moved here we set up a Personal Mail Box & did address changes.  We still have that PMB. Also, I have had other services done like laminating, copies, passport photos, fingerprints.

resp.text: Antana, Thank you for your review and allowing The UPS Store to serve you. We look forward to assisting you again.

name: Thomas Heckwolf
text: The store by target tapes boxes for returns for free. This store wants to charge a $1.00 to tape up a box. A whole roll of box tape cost $2.99

resp.text: We apologize for the inconvenience you may have received! This store has undergone new ownership as of April 2015. Our change in policies are geared towards providing positive customer service! We no longer charge for taping up boxes on drop offs. Please come visit us again!

name: Matthew Jones
text: Fast, friendly service.

resp.text: Thank you for the review. We really appreciate it!

name: Tom Barker
text: Super nice people, very helpful.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words :)

name: Kevin Fischer
text: I had the worst experience with this store and ups. They will say anything to avoid paying for there mistakes. I am done with UPS. I WILL NOT SHIP THROUGH THEM AGAIN.

resp.text: Kevin, I apologize for your bad experience with UPS. UPS denied your claim based on insufficient packing materials. You had a very large 80 pound box and the packing material you used was paper. The weight of your inner box crushed the paper causing the inner box to slide around inside of the larger box. UPS denied the claim for that purpose. For future you could allow The UPS Store to pack your items and then you would be protected by the Pack and Ship Guarantee.

name: Crystal Webb
text: Rep Marci is an extremely rude and snapped at my husband because his phone died and she couldn't scan and forcefully handed the package back to him.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We apologize for your experience inside the store.

name: David Vestal
text: Awesome service!

resp.text: :) We thank you for the kind words!!

name: Joshua Thurston
text: Beware if you want something notarized it is $10 per document! Even though I didn’t ask and should have they did not mention that their fee was so high!

resp.text: Hello we do apologize you didn't have a positive experience : (. Yes, there is a $5.00 Notary fee, and a $5.00 clerical fee for this service, so the total does add to $10.00. Our notaries go through extensive trainig. Please come and see us or call for any questions concerning notaries :)

name: philip ballou
text: Good service

resp.text: Thank you for your review.  We appreciate your kind words.

name: Robert Barinowski
text: Don't put up that you have extended hours when you don't.

resp.text: We apologize for the inconvenience of the store hours. We extended business hours the week prior to the Holiday week. Hours of operation reverted back to normal business hours on Monday 12/21 through the holidays. We apologize the website may have not updated as swiftly as we like. Please come by and see us to confirm store hours!

name: Charlie Niel
text: It has been great. The lady in the front office was extremely nice and the fellows in the back were great as well. I highly recommend Recycle Service Corporation. Not only was their services top of the line, I called around town first before I went. I was shopping for the best prices. Recycle Service Corporation had the best price over any other shredding company I called.

name: Bill Furr
text: This is the place to go for paper shredding!  Convenient, easy, friendly, and super reasonable prices (crammed full copy paper box of tax documents for $5).  You don't have to remove the staples or paper clips.  You can even watch your stuff go into the shredder.  I am glad I found this place and will use them again.  I don't know what some other reviewers were thinking about the location.  They were easy to find and I had no problem parking.  They even unloaded my car. They are at 115 Eastdale Road South behind the Crystal across from Eastdale Mall.  They are open Monday - Friday: 8:00 am - 4:00 pm, closed: 12:00 pm - 1:00 pm.

name: Markeith Shaw
text: Business is very easy to pass by. Once you come to the intersection of S Eastdale Street..turn right at Krystal’s and U Can Rent..come up about 200ft (Slowly) and when you the yellow poles and the Animal Clinic on your right (turn between the yellow poles and clinic)..building is at the back. You have enough room to make a turn around..that’s if you can drive!!

name: Jose Delarosa
text: Had a 0830 appointment the following day, called and was given permission to park on premises. As I arrived, I was asked if I wanted to dock n possibly get loaded that evening. The business is great and friendly gave it a 4 star due to the narrow road and traffic. Otherwise 👍

name: Brad Doucette
text: Best shredding service in Montgomery area. The person helped me unload the boxes in my car to shred. Office clerk was very nice. Will use their service again.

name: Priscilla Caldwell
text: I have shredded confidential papers and watched it being shredded. I have  come by many times. The staff Is  always so nice and kind. I have shredded with them for many years. Always a good experience. Many of my friends shred thier papers there as well. We are very pleased. Thanks so much for being my favorite place to shred. Keep up the good work.

name: Kathy Barber
text: I was able to dispose of old personal documents knowing that they would be shredded into a million little pieces!  The price was right too!  The staff is friendly and helpful!  I would recommend using them!

name: Linda Perdue
text: United Heating called Recycle Service to come to our location to shred several years of documents. The person who answered the phone was very pleasant and gave us several choices of dates and times that they could come out with the mobile shred truck. Phil arrived on time and began the task of shredding over 400 boxes. He broke down each box after dumping the contents into the container for shredding. He was very neat and left no trash behind. We had boxes @ 2 different locations in the building and he moved the truck as we requested. In the future we will always use Recycle Service as they are friendly , helpful and do a wonderful job, from the person who answered phone to the guy who did the shredding.

name: madalyn houde
text: Great and friendly staff! I will definitely  using them again!

name: Lee Russell
text: I have been using this Company for recycling services for over 10 years and couldn't be more satisfied.

name: Warren Miller
text: The staff was friendly and helped unload my vehicle. I have been there numerous times and the staff was always very friendly. I could not ask for a better experience.

text: The young lady with the blonde short wig & long eyelashes is very rude & unprofessional. I came in several times & she doesn't greet customers. If the lines were too long she’d roll her eyes. I heard her using profanity on the job. One time I came in she was so busy flirting with her co worker she didn’t even notice anyone at the desk or maybe she didn’t care to stop her foolishness & help. Everyone else is great!!! I’m a business owner & I use this location often. I will be contacting  corporate. She needs a job that matches her nasty attitude.

name: James Beam

name: SOLANGE AWAH
text: Terrible lost my package and did nothing

text: I had amazing customer service from the entire team! Brittany handled my packages at the register and gave impeccable cs. Her co-worker Chelsea very kind and engaging though she wasnt personally assisting me. The team leader Chantell was extremely personable and informative with additional questions/concerns I had about shipping time for my amazon returns. These women made me feel very welcome and I left with a confidence that my packages would get to there destination in a timely well cared for manner!

text: Showed up two minutes before they say they close just to do a quick check deposit into my usaa account and the door was locked and the guy saw me and didn't care.  Talk about poor customer service. Locking the door before the posted closing time.

resp.text: I am really sorry we couldn't help you yesterday with your USAA deposit. I did a review of the security tapes and found that we were on the dot of closing at 6:30. Once we close, we cannot access the systems to do a deposit. If you know you are running a little late, please give the store a call and let us see if we can't wait for you and process your transaction. We value your business and feedback.

name: Phyllis Carnes
text: a GREAT staff  they are always willig to assist and always smiling and friendly  i look forward to goig in their store

name: Cindy
text: 'Chelsea' was rude and unhelpful. Will go to another location after our experience today.

resp.text: I am so sorry that you had a bad experience at The UPS Store. We strive to give world class service every day. Sometimes we fail. We have discussed your situation and have learned how to better serve you when you return. We value your business and hope you will give us another try soon. Clare, owner The UPS Store

name: Maleika Rene'
text: The owner of this UPS franchise is unfair in her business practices!  My mother (senior citizen) rented a box from her store and realized that it's not the box that she needed and the owner would not refund her or allow her to get out of the box.  It was less than 24 hours.  The price of the box is RIDICULOUS and I know because I own 3 PMBs with 2 of them being at UPS stores.  This store and a couple of others in the area are definitely price gauging and need to be ashamed of themselves.  As a business owner, it's one thing to make a profit, it's another thing to be absolutely ridiculous with human errors.  Some policies CAN be adjusted.  Just remember, KARMA is real and the BBB and UPS headquarters will know about this incident.  As soon as her contract is up, she will be moving to a UPS store that has sense and truly CARES about their customers...not just taking their money for profit!

name: Martin Schaffer
text:
After a friend sent me a package from this store, I sent her one and by mistake, I used the address of the store. There was a return address on the package but it never came back to me.
The person I talked to on the phone, employee of the store,  was not helpful at all.

name: Mediocre Photography
text: Off and on service.  Most times it is quick and easy drop offs for me.  One time I was told I had to buy the tape to tape my package up (they had always taped it for me).. So I bought an entire roll of package tape just for that one instance.  Most times the employees are friendly and helpful... But there is a young girl there that isn't friendly and gives one the sense of rudeness just in her lack of personality.  Oh well, thanks to Amazon's new set up that allows me to drop things off without a label, my experiences have been good ones.  🤗

resp.text: Thank you so much for the feedback! We definitely always want to try to have a smile on our faces when our customers walk through the door. Several new employees have started recently for the holiday rush so we apologize if you've experienced anything at all negative or unpleasant. We will be sure to remind all of our employees to keep a positive attitude towards everyone who walks into our store. Thank you!

name: Nathon Roden
text: I have no idea how ups is in other parts of the country but when it hits ft.payne it is the absolute worst shipping company ever. Swear they don't update tracking there 70% of the time. They constantly miss "scheduled delivery time" its so bad I've convinced my company to no longer use them and instead we ship FedEx. I swear I wish Amazon would make FedEx an option.

name: Jess Medley
text:
I had a package sent to Colorado that was time sensitive. I was assured it would be fine and to just let them take care of it. The package ended up getting lost, spent almost a month trying “to locate it”, and then redeliver to the correct address. The people that work at this location do not seem very knowledgeable about their jobs and were of no help, and very rude at that! The shipment was ruined by the time it was actually delivered and when I contacted them to see if I could at least get my money back for the shipping, or anything for that matter, they were extremely rude.
I recommend USPS or The Package Store! Anywhere but here!

name: Mariah Keith
text:
Unexceptable customer service!
Rude seasoned employee and improperly trained "new" one.  Listed as an Amazon no print return drop off facility however they are unable to scan the Amazon generated return label and want to charge you $2.33 for another. Waited for 10+ minutes for them to receive the label that was sent directly to their verified email twice. Asked about alternative options - none. Walked out and took the package to the local "Package Store" in and out in under 2 minutes free off charge.

name: david walker
text: The folks working there were friendly enough.  But I took a file by on Friday afternoon to be printed in book form on better paper stock than normal bond.  This is for an instructional manual for my office.  The printing is fine.  But when I got it back to my office and tried to add it to my 3-ring binder, the holes they punched would not work.  They're not standard.  On top of that, they punched the last 3 chapters and the index completely backwards.  My last time to use The UPS Store for anything.

resp.text: Mr. Walker, thank you for bringing this to our attention.  I am sorry that we did not do a good job.  If you will, let us reprint and punch the holes properly.  We checked the hole puncher and did find it out of adjustment.  It has been fixed.  We are sorry that this has happened.  Thank You.

name: Screw Rti
text: I ordered something that was expensive. My time frame window was between 9-1pm. I have stated home all day to insure the package was not left out too long due to I live in apartments. It’s nearly 5 and the package has not been delivered. These guys really need to stick to there quotes they give people. I’ve wasted my whole day waiting. I will not be using this service again if I can help it.

name: SHARRON “SHERRIE” BANNISTER
text:
I dont recommend this business, I was over charged, given terrible quality photos and was expected to keep.  She refused to make it right, would not give refund.  I wish I could show a picture of the items that I was charged for.

Update:
The owner contacted me and offered a complete refund.   I really appreciate that he was kind and understanding.   He asked for a copy to show the employees at that location the errors that were made.  I believe Larry is an honest business man and he deserves another chance.

resp.text:
Dear Sharron Bannister,

Firstly, we’d like to extend our most sincere condolences on the loss of your loved one. We can’t begin to know exactly what you're dealing with, and we extend our thoughts and prayers to you and your family during this trying time.

Concerning the event in question, we’re both sorry and surprised to hear of the negative experience you had at our store. As we all know, everyone has their own unique take on any given situation, and we’d just like to briefly give ours, so that we are all on the same page. When we assisted the customer on the day in question, we had the customer review and approve the print before moving forward. We do this to ensure that all of our customers are satisfied with the quality before we start running the job, as once we’ve begun, we cannot make adjustments and have already begun incurring costs.

In this case, seeing as the customer reviewed and approved a proof, we simply did not know there was even a concern until your family began leaving several reviews, all of which tell a different story than what we experienced, and candidly, we understand. This is a difficult time for all, and we can absolutely understand how difficult of a time this must be. We're dedicated to not only provided excellent products with equally excellent service, but we’re committed to being a part of the community, and we would never ask a customer to accept a product they weren’t happy with. Had we known there were issues with the prints prior to customer approval, or with the finished product when they were reviewed when you returned to pick them up, we would have done and will do everything possible to rectify this for you, and we’re committed to doing so again in the future.

Your feedback is important to us, and it doesn’t fall on deaf ears.
Thank You,
Larry Stephens

name: Bo Doeg
text: Only use this location if it is last ditch, while the atmosphere was comfortable and quiet the only thing these folks are interested in is how fast they can take your money. The young lady working the counter was rude and completely unhelpful. She had an air if disdain when I asked any questions as if it was just too much to bear. I asked for a next day shipment and was given a regular label. When I asked she just told me that I was doing ok. When I finished the label o asked if that was all I needed to do to get next day shipping, she got upset that I hadn't made it clear I wanted next day shipping. I clearly asked twice for a next day label. Over all I would use the USPS from now on, it is a small wonder that anything gets shipped from this location. This UPS store had garbage service. Customers BEWARE!

name: Logan LeGrande
text: Overpriced and management is rude to employees

name: Kevin Adams
text: So very sad that people choose to make money wrongfully, off the death of others family members. My sisters and I Went to the UPS store in Fort Payne to have some obituary cards printed of our deceased parents, the lady at the counter only let me print one copy and then made copies of that making all but the original very poor quality. On one family members cards the owner mistakenly forgot to turn the paper and double printed over the first copy making it completely impossible to read, but laminated over it anyway and charged me for the unreadable copy. Even worse blamed me for the error even though she was the only one with access to the printer which was behind the counter. Great way to run a business, blaming the customer for your error and even worse selling a product that was meant to be a gift that can’t even be read. When my sister took the cards back to the store the owner refused to try to make it up or even give a  refund while screaming and insulting my sister. A very expensive lesson since we were over charged to begin with and still are without the obituary cards. This is a very dishonest way of doing business, not worthy of anyone’s business. We will never do business with that store again.

Thank You,
