name: Wendy Rosen
text: This UPS Store is the most hatefully, rude, disrespectful bunch of inexperienced kids I have ever seen in a franchised store. I deal with the local Authorized Shipping Center call "The Package Store" they are the best and very smart and knowledgeable people, they can ship "UPS", "FedEx". "DHL" and "USPS" giving customers more options instead of just one choice.

name: Warrior4truth
text: I was charged 2.50 for one copy of paper and no computer use. I sent my page via email to their computer and the foreign lady was rude and of absolutely no use or help to explain why. We will no longer use this location.

resp.text:
Being a small veteran owned business we do have to charge for our services.  We used our computer to retrieve your email, opening your file and printing your document.  These are the items that went into the $2.50 charge to get you your document.

Thank You,
Larry Stephens

name: Thori Brewer
text: Very friendly and knowledgeable staff!  Always have done a good job for me!

name: Becky Harris
text: Super friendly staff. Quick in and out stop.

name: d k
text: Nice store and staff.

name: Skillsusa Alabama
text: Great service.

name: Kathy I
text: I'm happy that I ventured into this business. They are an exceptional group of employees. Eager to help you with your packages and what ever else you are looking for. I recommend this store for all of your shipping needs and copying. Thank you UPS for becoming my new, to go to place.

name: Kimberly Clark
text: Finally a place that understands awesome customer service will bring people back!  Each time I’ve went in or called they have went above and beyond!  Today it was Dominic York with great packaging suggestions for my odd shaped  mail item.  A few weeks ago it was Louis Huluska taking time during the busy Christmas season to help me.  I no longer go anywhere else and tell all my friends to do their mailing here. Wonderful staff!

name: martin zummach
text:
the completely inept desk clerk said she couldn’t look up ups account and she was provided my corporate account number and contact info and she still made the excuse they are just a franchise.  i will use fedex next time. i even sent them a pic of my preprinted ups shipping label with account and name preprinted. duh
is it just alabama iq?

name: Matt MacKay
text: I’m in Nevada and they’re in Alabama trying to ship four paintings. They were super friendly and helpful providing a quote— and much more affordable and timely than the moving company. Louis was especially helpful! He followed up consistently with tracking numbers and packaged the paintings so securely. I was extremely pleased with how quickly they came and the condition they arrived in for the price.

name: Joanna L
text: I had some returns to Amazon and Old Navy. Super easy and fast. I was greeted pretty much as soon as I entered the store and assisted quickly.

name: Ramiro Santiago
text: Not crowded and people are wearing masks and keeping distance. Store is clean and aisles are roomy.

name: Carol Laney
text: I needed help sending a 24 x 36 painting and they were so helpful. I received a call from my family and they received it with no problems. They bragged on how well it was packed. Thank you UPS!

name: Heather James
text: I went to The Ups Store of Enterprise this morning and the two young ladies open the store like 10 minutes early so could ship my packages to my elderly mother and family for Christmas, thank you ladies for assisting me and making my holiday shipment less stressful. I was in and out the store quickly. I believe her name was Alexis she had a pleasant smile, great hospitality and exceptional customer service skills her co- worker (I do not know her name), she was very pleasant as well. You all have a great staff! I will be back soon.

name: Kitty Keener
text: Always fast and helpful service! Very clean inside which is important during these times.

name: Garrett T
text: Louis and Alexis were extremely helpful and had a pleasantly cheerful demeanor.  I went in the store on a mission to get a card blown up to a bigger size, and was unsure of the precise size that I needed. They willingly took the time and walked me through the sizes he demonstrated and helped me arrive to a decision.  I will always do business with them now.  Thank you!!!

name: Vibity 360
text: Great customer service! Every visit I am welcomed by a friendly staff member who is happy to help. I recently had some Christmas cards printed and they turned out perfect. Their manager and notary public is extremely knowledgeable and professional. Thank you UPS Enterprise.

resp.text:
Hi Vibity 360,

We are incredibly grateful that you took the time out to leave us this note. Our company values put customer satisfaction as top priority and we are committed to our customers. Its customers like you that make our job wonderful. We look forward to serving you again.

Thank you,
The UPS Store 6732
334-417-0051

name: Elizabeth Armstrong
text:
The reason I’m leaving 3 star review is because of the price of the boxes. We needed one large box and the box cost $14. We couldn’t even believe it. The return was already paid for so it was $14 for just the box. Definitely make sure you buy your box elsewhere and then use their services.
•The actual service is great and the people are kind and handle your service quickly.

name: Ginger Cofer
text:
Well the upped the price to print shipping labels to $2.50. I walked in and out the UPS door today 3 times to get a box shipped.
I expected to pay for it but not that much.
Everything being severely overpriced is going to run off business. I will figure out another way to access UPS for shipping.
Walmart and lowes both sell boxes.

name: John Doe
text: i will give negative 10 if i could. I needed to return amazon prime  order they tried to charge 2.25$ for print label. I left my wallet at home asked if possible to avoid charge this time they say no! very greedy people works there

name: Aa Ron
text: had wrong label code apparently... :(

name: Sonia Burns
text: The store manager open his door when he just closed for the day so that I could make copies of my resume. He didn't charge me and he asked what I did before I moved to Enterprise and wished me luck. Now, I feel happy about my move here. Thank you for your kindness.

name: Hannah Pursley
text: They really shouldn't advertise notary. I took a paper in and was told to take it to the dothan store because "she didn't like to notarize without the other notary" why be a notary? In all honesty, she done it for my husband but said no to me. Seems sexist to me.

name: Ben Solo
text: This location advertises that they have a notary. The guy I talked to refused to notarize my document. He said he was “uncomfortable because he had not finished his training”. Are you a notary or not? He seemed pretty dense. What a joke. Thank you for wasting my time. FWIW the loan office in the same strip mall will notarize a document without giving you some lame excuse.

resp.text:
Dear Ben Solo,
We want to sincerely apologize for your negative experience in our store. However, we'd like to learn more about your situation and what exactly happened. We want to make things right. So, please give us a call on 334-417-0051. You can also email us at store6732@theupsstore.com and we will get back to you promptly. We look forward to hearing from you and earning you back your business.

text: The staff is so professional and friendly. I absolutely love the family atmosphere that i feel every time when i go to drop items off for my job. The store manger Mr.Wade is a true example of a rare gem..God bless this whole staff..Candlewood Suite's Staff loves ya!!

name: Georgia Ford
text: Today one of your men delivered 2 boxes to my house 87 Bryan Ct. Dora, AL.  I am in a wheel chair and it takes me a bit to answer the door.  It was pouring down rain and he banged on the door and left the boxes on the porch in the rain and ran back to his truck.  By the time I got to the door and got it opened he was driving off.  This was the worst possible thing he could have done.  I am not happy.

resp.text: I sincerely apologize for the inadequate service.  We, however, at The UPS Store, have nothing to do with drivers or deliveries.  We are a Franchise of UPS, and have Retail establishments only.  The best possible thing that you can do, is to call UPS Customer Service and explain your situation.  They will be more than happy to message the hub in Birmingham, where this driver comes from, and let them know of your circumstances, so that this won't happen again.  Although we actually had nothing to do with this delivery, here at The UPS Store, along with UPS, value your business and appreciate you bringing this to our attention.  We will pass it along to UPS so they can deal with it accordingly.  Their phone number is 1-800-742-5877.  It is a voice prompt system, so if you'll simply say, "Missed delivery" a few times, it will pass you along to a live operator.  Thank you again for your business and if we can help you in any way at The UPS Store in Jasper, we'll be more than happy to do so.  Jeff Graham, Owner

text: Love 30+ minute wait times when you're the ONLY person in the store? Incompetence? An army of octogenarians who can't get out of their own way? This is the place for you! Every time I go here, which is only to ship something next day air out of desperation, I swear it's the LAST TIME. You'd be better off WALKING your package to its destination.

resp.text: We never have more than a 10 minute wait in our store. Complex print jobs do sometimes take longer, but there are always 2 or more employees and we pride ourselves on our quick and competent customer service. I'm sorry that you had a bad experience and we'd love to have the chance to make it right. I've owned this store for over 15 years now, and wouldn't be here without the strength of my staff, the ability to solve problems, and the great customers that come into my store time and time again.

Items such as appliances and fragile items require specific packaging to ensure that all packages arrive in both a timely and safe manner. We do apologize if you felt that our prices were too high or costly. Please feel free to contact us here at the store to resolve any issues you experienced during your visit.

Thank you,
Management

I asked them to download 1 sheet of paper and print it so I Could sign it. Then have them scan it into a pdf and email it to me. Foley price $14, Gulf Shores $6.50. You judge.

text: I normally dont review stores, but it this case I have to!  I walked into the ups store and felt like I was a priority. text: I used ups to make copies. I drop off my copies to be single copy. The employee asked when I would like them. I said as soon as I was ready. The next day I sent someone to pick them up and she was told they won't be ready until sometime Monday, which was fine. But then I get a voicemail like two hours later on Thursday that they are ready. So I sent that same person to pick them up and pay $138.00. I then went over the copies about 400 was single copy, the rest was double copy which was over 1400. I had to separate the papers myself, which I was told by a co-worker they do that.I tired for a week to talk to someone about my order. When I finely did that same person who made my copy told me that I didn't say single and if I want to have them redo I will have to pay again. She pretty much blame me the customer because she didn't hear me. There was no form of any kind for me to fill out leave my instruction. Since she was the manager I ask to speak to the owner. She told me a time but when I called he was not their, I been trying to get ahold of him for a couple of days. I will not be using their service again, ever through they did give me a discount rate since these copies were for my class. I was always told the customer was always right from working in retail before.

I’m still out all the time involved, the package contents, and now I have to do it all over again shipping through somewhere else. I was told they are busy and don’t have time to answer the phone. So if you want your package delivered, go somewhere else. Oh and to top it off, they entered my name and address in wrong as well so it won’t be making it back to me either.

Even tho i called amazon and they gave me a refund and cancelled the book from my list, im still not understand how my book was not received when it was the only item in the box. Did they send an empty box? Where is the book? To many unanswered questions.

name: Debbie Mccay
text: I had an extremely important documents I needed to send overnight from Moody Alabama to Vista California. I paid $44.14 to overnight this package. Yes I signed a paper but didn’t really read it. The clerk did not explain anything to me he acted like there was no problem and that it would get there the next day. What I didn’t know was he sent it through the US Postal Service and that there was no guarantee it would get there the next day. I sent it February 19 thinking it would get there February 20. I did not get there till Saturday the 22nd. And I’m tall too bad so sad by UPS. Those UPS stores are independent and can send an use any carrier service they want. I will never used UPS in Trussville Alabama

name: Eric Taylor
text: I rented a mailbox here today. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The cost was also much more reasonable than I thought it would be. The store, products and services are quite nice. I'm sure I'll be going back for more than just getting my mail.

name: Jamie Clayton
text: Have had to send back several orders and each time I go to the UPS store here in Trussville Alabama I am greeted with nothing but wonderful customer service and they are always eager to help me. My husband for his company and must utilize several things at the UPS Store offers he is very pleased let the customer service team receives

name: Frog Price
text: Smart, helpful employees. Notary service took only minutes. Good computer system for use to build needed flyer.

name: G C
text:
Extremely rude, unhelpful and unkind employees
I would walk my package to it’s destination before I went back in this store....

name: P Bark
text: Notary public service  $10.00, staff very friendly, respectful, and helpful good location plenty of parking

name: Christina Boggan
text: We've had a business mailbox there for 4 years. Very good service and friendly. Always willing to help.

name: Andy Bass
text: I paid for professional packaging of a framed picture. They placed my item in a box half filled with only peanuts, so my picture was destroyed. After 2 weeks they provided only a partial refund to make up for their mistake. DO NOT USE THESE GUYS!!!! They have no idea what they are doing!

name: Mick McMeme
text: Always reliable, always competent. Have had to ship expensive, fragile items and these guys have never disappointed.

name: Randy Coker
text: The best location to do business. Always  friendly.

name: James “XDMAN” Nicholas
text: Always friendly and give great service.

name: Evelyn Roebuck
text: Excellent service and great csr

name: Justin Maxwell
text: Quick and friendly service

name: Freeman Presson
text: I had a booklet printed and bound here. The work was perfect, and I got a great price. Service was superbly fast and friendly.

name: Jamie McLynn
text: Always the most helpful staff!! Really appreciate the customer service here.

name: Rebecca Stivender
text: They are the best!!  I walked in frantically trying to get an urgent package to family out of town, and Anna was so kind and helpful.  She truly went above and beyond!

name: Madison K.
text: Went into this location not knowing exactly how I wanted my art to be printed, but Anna took the time to talk it through and gave us multiple options. She definitely went the extra mile, and my print turned out even better than what I imagined! Thank you, Anna!!!!

name: Sam Sharples
text: By far the best shipping location in Birmingham. I gladly drive by multiple other UPS and Fedex locations and suffer parking in Five Points to use this location. They don’t nickel and dime customers, but earn business through respect and friendliness.

name: Aakruti Sharma
text: Awesome store with super-friendly staff!

name: CeeDeeAre 4Real
text: Five Stars - Good experience at this UPS store.  Erika, Bradley and Carlos were of tremendous help!  I will go there now on a regular basis.  Thanks so much.

name: Ritika Ramchandani
text: Went it needing to check on a package That I paid for overnight shipping for 3-5 days ago. They basically told me they couldn’t do anything about and that I was informed when dropped the package off that they wouldn’t be able to do anything. I was not informed of that, yet the *manager* persists that “all his people are well trained so he knows that I was informed.” I LAUGHT at that response. Trust your customer if they told you that no one told them what you’re telling them. Do not insult their integrity by CLAIMING that “all your employees are well trained and would’ve told you.” CLEARLY THEY WERE NOT, TRY AGAIN.

resp.text:
Ritika, we hear you and we understand your frustration. As we have mentioned already, we are a third party vendor of UPS services, not UPS themselves. UPS currently does not guarantee delivery dates for any packages due to Covid19. Additionally, once UPS has picked up your package from our retail location, we no longer have possession of it, and therefore cannot just provide it back to you.

We would love it if you direct your concerns to the UPS customer service department at 1-800-742-5877.

name: c p
text: I will never go here, or any other ups store. You pay $200 for the day they tell you, but your package arrives a week later, and all they say is WELL!!!!. Well...... You don't have to worry about my business or anyone I know using you for any shipping needs.

resp.text:
We are so sorry you had an unfortunate experience at The UPS Store in Southside.  We understand your frustration with the cost of shipping and the delivery delay, but the holidays are a tough time for all carriers, not just UPS.  Guarantee dates are suspended due to volume.  Additionally, we at The UPS Store have no control over the pricing or delivery of packages. We are small business owners - franchisees who do not set pricing or guarantees.

As for being told, "Oh, well..." this is a customer service issue that we will look into.  We appreciate you bringing it to our attention and hope you will give us another opportunity to show you the World Class Customer Service we strive for.

name: Rhiannon Deierhoi Reed
text: Have had great success with this location the past two years making calendars for family. Very courteous employees, efficient service, and high quality products. I will continue to use this spot for future printing needs!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words! We are always glad to hear that we've done our job right - "courteous employees, efficient service, and high quality products" describes our mission perfectly!

name: Tina Cao
text: The BEST ever!!! Staffs are so friendly and professional, and they always give me the best experience. Every time I go there they always manage to get me out of there in less than 5 minutes which is IMPRESSIVE!!!

resp.text:
Tina,

We appreciate your review, and we're so glad you enjoyed your experience with us. Come back and see us soon!

name: S King
text: Best place around! All the employees are so nice and eager to help you. Ask for Jaelynn, he’s the best! Spent almost an hour with me trying to work with an issue I had. So awesome

resp.text:
S King,

We're so glad to hear you had a good experience, and we always appreciate a shout-out for an individual staff member. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Jason “Squig” McCrory
text: A very professional and knowledgeable staff. The print shop is amazing. As a photographer I work hard capturing images for my clients and The UPS Store In five points always takes care of my needs, so I can serve my clients faster.

resp.text:
Jason,

We appreciate your continued business, and I look forward to seeing you soon!

name: Barbara Schwartz
text:
Better Than the Rest!
Attentive, knowledgeable, engaging staff. Neat, well equipped store. Free parking in back. Took pack & ship order in on Wednesday two weeks before Christmas. Decided to use UPS ground. Packages were delivered several states away on Friday.

resp.text: Barbara, we're so glad to hear you enjoyed your experience with us and received the services you needed! We appreciate you taking the time to leave a detailed review, and we look forward to serving you in the future!

name: Chandra Brown
text: UPS sucks I had to drive around town to find all of their drop boxes that are in weird buildings and convenience stores, and the drop boxes are so small u really can't put in any normal to medium packages. Which isn't convenient. Why would a packing and shipping company have such small drop boxes to begin with. The package wouldn't fit in the box. The post office drop box is much larger. Wow ..... UPS, thanks for nothing.  And all of your locations close early...the latest is open to 7pm. The Main post office is open later than that and less expensive. Why not have at least one location in the City of Birmingham or surrounding areas that are open at least til midnight. UPS is in my opinion is a very inconvenient place to do business with. Two thumbs down

resp.text:
Chandra,

While we here at The UPS Store Southside understand your complaint, you are unfortunately responding to the wrong company.

The UPS Store Southside is a locally owned and operated franchise of The UPS Store, a chain of combination Print Shop and Pack-and-Ship vendor. We are ten folks from Birmingham who do graphic design and digital and wide-format printing and offer UPS, USPS, and DHL services as a third-party vendor.

Your complaint against the United Parcel Service, Inc is an understandable one, but rating our location 1* won't accomplish any change. We aren't the logistics company based out of Atlanta, and this location isn't owned by them either. Your review is understandably but incorrectly levied at us, and that hurts our business, despite that fact that we don't operate UPS trucks, nor do we maintain UPS drop boxes.

We know the name "The UPS Store" makes us sound like a corporate entity, but we're not, or else we couldn't say that the name "The UPS Store" was a stupid choice for loosely-affiliated franchises.

We would kindly ask that you remove your rating if you are not one of our customers, or that you correct your rating to reflect our service correctly if you have commissioned work from us before. Again, that would really help our locally owned small business thrive. We can also put you in touch with people at UPS who can actually help get your complaint to the right people. Please feel free to come in and see us, or email us at Store4088@TheUPSStore.com. We'd genuinely love to help you voice your complaint, as we frequently do to UPS ourselves.

Again, we appreciate your frustration, and we thank you in advance for correcting the record.

Jeff Flannery, Owner
Myra Fabian, Operations
Nick Salyers, Printing

name: Debbie Lagarde
text: I've visited this store numerous times since moving to town. It's become one of my favorite places to do business. The services I've employed include parcel shipment, printing, and notary. Usually I have questions about the task at hand, and the associates have been friendly, knowledgeable, and fun. They also don't mind giving newcomers to the area a head's up about local businesses. Impressed!

resp.text: Debbie, we're so glad to hear you've had a great experience! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Isaac
text:
Notary service is very unprofessional. Kept telling me to wait “couple of minutes” and ended up wasting  30 minutes of my time. My time is more valuable than the cost of your service.

Replying to the owner's response:
I was not informed that it would be up to half an hour. I was told to wait "Few minutes" and even if English isn't my first language, I understood that few ,even though isn't an exact term, it won't be a 20-30 minutes wait. If I didn't say something, I would've ended up waiting for more than 30 minutes. When I called the store the day before, i was told that Notary services are offered when you walk in.  the UPS store on 20th St North truly provides a walk in notary service.

I paid for the service at the cashier in advance as I wanted to save time and the "offer" you are talking about is how one of your employees brought back the money and receipt and handed it to me and told me to go to another store. So you basically kicked me out. That was also very disrespectful.

I never requested a special treatment because of my station or title. So don't use that. I am only informing people on here that the Notary Service is unprofessional.

resp.text:
Isaac,

As we informed you when you arrived, the only notary in-store when you arrived also serves as our General Manager, our Chief Graphic Designer, and our primary Printer. You were informed that it could be several minutes, up to half an hour, and that there were Notaries Public at other stores, which we offered to direct you to. You declined that offer and left after 20 minutes. We apologize that you are dissatisfied with the timeliness in which you were served, however, your time is not more valuable than that of the customers who arrived and submitted orders before you. We are committed to serving all of our customers equally, regardless of station or title.

name: Angie Boston
text: The young lady at the counter greeted me as soon as I walked through the door.  I was returning DirecTV equipment and was somewhat puzzled by the company's instructions which weren't too thorough.  However, she educated me really well on the  items they didn't want returned to them.  She checked that I had not left batteries.in the remote which I had intended to check before leaving home but forgot to do.  She was very friendly, courteous, and  knowledgeable.

resp.text: Thank you Angie, we appreciate your business and look forward to serving you in the future!

name: Ashley Kuntz
text: This is my favorite UPS store in Birmingham. I’d rather wait and go to this store on my way into work than go to the store down the street from my house. The staff at the Southside location are so incredibly helpful. Even when I don’t have everything perfectly prepared, they quickly take care of the package and get me checked out. I can’t believe I actually care enough about a UPS store to write a review, but this one is worth the time. Thanks, Folks. You rock!

resp.text:
Thanks Ashley! We are so thankful for your review. We hope to see you again soon!
-Management

name: Madeline Smith
text: I was in Birmingham from Boston, visiting a critically ill friend at UAB.  In the middle of that stress, urgent business came up.  Thankfully a nurse said 'go to the UPS Store up the street.'  Within minutes I was in the good hands of Bradley and the UPS team.  Printed out the documents, signed, notarized, faxed and then shipped overnight.  All that is part of their business model - however, it was the caring, the calming, the empathy  for my situation that made this an exceptional five star experience.   Grateful.

resp.text: Madeline, I'm so glad to hear you had an exceptional experience at our store, and we keep you and your friend in our hearts during their recovery. We hope you can come back and see us under better circumstances in the future!

name: Lauren Weekley
text:
Best place to go for any design or print needs, hands down!! Nick can work miracles. If you need something done and they for some reason can't do it in house, he'll help you figure out the best way to get it done. Nick has come in early, stayed late, delivered print to me personally when I couldn't pick it up. The entire staff at this store is amazing and helpful. 10/10, 5 stars, A+

Oh and they pack and ship things too

name: Michael Todd
text: Stopped in to drop off a package, very polite and professional staff, will definitely use them again.

resp.text:
Michael,

We're glad you had a good experience, come back and see us!

name: johnnie shaneyfelt
text: Update your store hours on Google so people don’t drive over in the rain during a pandemic to drop off packages. Says your open until 7 but the door says 6

resp.text:
Johnnie,

We appreciate your feedback and we apologize for the miscommunication. Google, without our knowledge, reverted our online hours listing to the pre-Covid hours, In accordance with Gov Ivey's Safer-at-Home ordinance, we will maintain our current limited hours until further notice. Please know you can always check our website and social media accounts for more current updates.

We have informed our tech team, who is working on a fix for the Google listing. Again, we apologize for any inconvenience, and we look forward to serving you in the future.

name: Mel Christian
text: I have issues with the online ordering system but that is not the fault of the local Birmingham, AL  Southside employees. I live in Tuscaloosa and needed six 11 x 17 signs printed in about a five hour window so I could frame them for a Birmingham theatre company. When I called to see if I could get them earlier than the 6pm quote, the woman helping me (I wish I had asked her name but this was the afternoon of  9/13/19 if that helps) said she would change some things around and get them for me by 3pm. I cannot tell you how much time and anxiety that saved me! Also while I as there I noted the other gentleman working  with her jumped up the minute a customer came in and was very professional and cordial.  In a world where customer service has gone down the toilet that really means something! I've also a few years ago popped by to get a notary signature and this location was completely helpful. Only complaint is the parking but...big city...whatcha gonna do? Again, thank you for helping me! It meant so much!

resp.text:
Mel,

We really appreciate you taking the time to share your experience, and I'm glad we got you taken care of! We are working to improve the parking, look for some major improvements in that area over the next year or so!

Come back and see us anytime, we'll save you a spot!

name: Jo hiNes
text: My printer wasn't working before I had to hwad to class... I emailed them while I was on the way and had my papwrs printed quickly. I was in and out in 5 minutes. I also bought a sympathy card and mailed off a package. They we're also VERY nice and courteous! Will definitely be back!!!

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your kind review! We work really hard at providing world class customer service to everyone no matter how big or small the job is; We look forward to seeing you again.
Thanks
-Management

name: Brandon Moore
text: I visited this store yesterday to drop off a package. I needed the box taped and I also need the label cut and taped to the box. I went in expecting them to sell me a roll of tape and scissors like the post office would make you do. I was surprised when I walked in to a very friendly staff that took my package and said well have this taped and ready to go today. I was out the door in less than 30 seconds! I highly recommend this ups store for all your shipping needs.

name: Reginald Croom
text: I have had the pleasure of working with the UPS Store team for many years. They are very attentive and detail oriented. A little patience is required considering the nature of this business. Great service, Great team!

resp.text: Reggie, we're so glad that you've had a good experience with us, and we're grateful for your continued patronage. We hope to see you soon!

name: Will Webb
text: Great customer service. Thanks especially to Nick for all the help shipping a package with dry ice. This (independently-operated) store really seems to go the extra mile for customers with unusual needs.

name: Gregory Kohlberg
text: Great customer service and I always can count on the deliveries scheduled

resp.text:
Gregory,

We're glad you have great experiences with us, and we're grateful for great customers like you!

name: Heather Dark
text: Unfortunately every time I go in this store (typically Saturday), the same employee is there with a snide remark, inappropriate statement, or just general rudeness that makes this place pretty unplesant for me. But, they’ve never lost a package, and have decent supplies so I’d say that part of the store is great.

resp.text: Heather, we, unfortunately, don't have enough information from what you've given to know what incidents you're referring to. If you would, please email us at store4088@theupsstore.com and answer a few questions for us so we can try to figure out what happened. Thanks.

name: Kristie Rankin
text: This location has always been a positive experience for me. Nick is very professional and almost reads my mind at times it seems.

resp.text: Kristie, we're so glad to hear about your great experience with us! We look forward to serving you again soon!

name: KDE5FAN
text:
Where to begin with this horror show, 1 star is much to high a rating.  The person I was dealing with was so horrible and incompetent that after 5-6 phone calls over 3 days(and zero of 4 emails responded to, emails with all the pertinent information for items to be picked up, packed and shipped) I asked to speak to a manager, well Bradley WAS the manager.  Great.  I asked if he had a supervisor or the owner and he dismissively told me HE was in charge - this is where the attitude ramped up, before it was somewhat subtle.

He would not respond to any email asking for quotes or telling me when they would pick up the items (the pickup service they offer).  It was like he didn't want to have record of the quotes or times in email.  He would respond to direct questions in email with "would you please just call me, how hard is that" - as if my schedule revolved around him.

After 3 weeks of trying to get them to pick up the auction lot, I made arrangements with another UPS store that would pick up the same day.  I called to cancel at the previous store, told Kody (who told Bradley while I was on the phone) and someone else as well and I also emailed the cancellation.  3-4 hours later they used the paperwork from the first email to pick up the items and I was informed by the other UPS store that the items were already picked up (the seller wasn't supposed to release it to them either but that isn't as much their fault)

When they packed up the items they used a huge box, about 3x larger than what was actually necessary basically tripling the cost of everything. It was very expensive now.  I knew this wasn't right so I emailed asking for the weight and dimensions of the box he used, and I got a reply of the dimensions and a "just call us" response.  This was after I had called 4-5 times that day and they were always too busy to talk.  Now he wanted me to call immediately (6 hours after the my first call) and when I didn't he proceeded to call 6 times in 30 minutes while I was  on the other line (call waiting beeping 40-50 times for each call, he just let it ring harassing me - I couldn't end my call it was important and why I called 6 hours prior and used email).

This harassment continued 3 more times with about 2-3 calls each time until their closing time (total of about 13-15 calls, ringing non-stop b/c no voicemail turned on).

My calls the next two days were hung up on, I never knew who answered the phone, but 5 calls were immediately hung up on when they were switched to an employee.

I called the other UPS store I had scheduled and told them what was going on and was going to have them pick up the items to ship.  I was informed of who to ask for at the other store and that they would be helpful.  I called back and got someone I hadn't worked with - Mikee.

This was a delight. From the very beginning the attitude was like night and day.  Bradley has no business working with customers or in customer service.  Mikee was helpful, promptly returning emails with complete answers and readable sentences, complete quotes, etc.  Included in the emails were the photos of how Bradley wrapped the items and it looked like a 4yr old had done it.

There were a couple fragile items, noted 3-4 times in previous emails (maybe Bradley can't read, IDK) that were to be wrapped in bubble wrap b/c they were glass.  These were the only things not in bubble wrap.  The large bulky durable plastic items were layered in bubble wrap and I told him they didn't need ANY.  So, Mikee took everything out of Bradley's packaging and re-packaged the items and did an EXCELLENT job.  I would rate that  part 5 stars,  but after 3+ weeks with Bradley, 1 star is too much.

The final shipping was less than 1/2 what Bradley quoted (and it wasn't $5 vs $10, it was MUCH higher).  The items arrived and everything looks to be in  order.

I just can't understand how this business can make Bradley a manager and deal with customers. I had another problem with  them 1 year ago with bad packaging on a piece of glassware, it looked like a 4yr old wrapped it too.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review. We truly do appreciate your feedback on where we can improve - and clearly, there is much room for improvement with the way we handled your shipment. We apologize that we fell short of the "World Class Customer Service" you were entitled to. We have addressed the situation with the manager and are taking steps to ensure it doesn't happen again. We acknowledge the 1-star rating we received from you and would appreciate the opportunity to prove to you that we are a 5-star store.

name: Oakside8
text: Great service. Friendly employees.

resp.text:
Oakside,

Great review, friendly customer. Come back and see us anytime and let us bump that 'great' up to an 'excellent'!

name: William Somerall
text: Courteous, attentive, and helpful. Highly recommended.

resp.text:
William,

We can't thank you enough for taking the time to leave us a review. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Larabeth Guthrie
text: This location has helped make sure I have professional items at a competitive rate regularly.  They are diligent about making sure everything is correct.

name: Jake Linder
text: Awful customer service. Three employees and not one said hello or I’ll be right with you. When I was finally waited on, the employee left me to help another customer and ignored me. UPS isn’t a charity and should expect professionalism from those they hire to represent them.

resp.text:
Jake,

First I want to thank you personally for taking the time to leave a review. We can't improve if we aren't held accountable, and I truly appreciate you taking the time.

Our SOP includes both an immediate greeting, as well as point-to-point customer assistance. Those procedures clearly were not followed, and for that we apologize. This is out of alignment with how we do business, and we are actively working to rectify those issues.

We know you have a choice in who you spend your money with, and we are working diligently to be better because you, the customer, deserve it. We look forward to doing better for you in the future.

name: Susan Henderson
text:
The UPS Store in Warrington, (Pensacola), Florida is equipped with the most courteous and knowledgeable staff who go above and beyond to help their customers.  It's a wonderful experience and I always get great service, walking out feeling good to have been helped by such nice people.  I have been to other UPS stores and haven't had the same experience.
Tom Kuklish is the owner/manager of this store and he is outstanding, always making sure his customers are taken care of, and if there are any problems, he's ready to solve them promptly and professionally.
S. Henderson

name: Champion Deivanayagam
text: Very professional service and the staff are always willing to help

resp.text: Champion, we're so glad to hear you enjoyed your experience at our store, and we look forward to working with you again in the future. Come back and see us!

name: S Garg
text: There is one of your employees at 20th Street South Birmingham store who is very rude. I have been to the store multiple times and he always behaves in a very condescending way. He has done it every time I go to the store, even if he is not assisting me. I think he is the store manager, Don't remember his name. He is tall white male, 6Ft something tall. I am writing this message as today he accused me of taking the store pen without checking if the store property was in place or not. I was carrying my own pen and I don't give a damn about a $1 pen but to be called out when it clearly wasn't UPS property without checking was really really rude. Please take necessary action, Thank you

name: Adrian Darren
text:
A few days ago I came in to have some designs and prints made up quickly.  I gave the instructions to the main graphics person and he didn't follow them.  I was upset with the situation and then he had the audacity to argue my instructions with me.  It wasted my time and I couldn't believe that was his idea of customer service.

I will be taking my business to the store in Homewood from now on.

resp.text: Unfortunately, as we expressed to you that day, The person you spoke with first (our night manager) and the person you spoke with second (our Print Manager) are two different people. As you'll recall, our Print Manager attempted to express this to you that day, as he wasn't in the store at that time you claimed to have spoken with him. Additionally, the reason why your instructions weren't followed was because when asked multiple times about your instructions, your answer was "I don't care." In the future, speaking to the correct people and making specific requests will eliminate the guesswork.

name: Lisa Mani
text: Very professional and courteous on the phone and in the store.

resp.text:
Thank You Lisa! We appreciate your kind response and we look forward to doing future business with you.
-Management

name: Dee Winter
text: THE Worst UPS store.   Staff does not return calls and reply to emails.  They make promises that they don't support.

resp.text:
Dee,

Firstly, thank you for taking the time. I know nobody enjoys having a negative experience, regardless of the 'why', but it would help me immensely to know more about your specific instance. If you'd be so kind, please email us directly at store4088@theupsstore.com and let us know more about what happened. We take situations like this very seriously, but we often don't even know something has happened off-book until we see reviews like this.

I'm sorry you had a bad experience, and I'd like to do what I can to fix that for the future, and see if there's anything we can do to rectify your specific issue as well. Again, we sincerely thank you for taking the time to hold us accountable, it's the only way we can improve.

name: ARNOLD WILLIAMS
text: Professional, friendly, efficient...They understand the value of service and relationship. Thanks Guys!

name: Joseph Ryan Jones
text: Staff is always friendly and knowledgeable. Good hours

resp.text: Thank you so much for the good review, Mr. Jones! We look forward to serving you again!

name: peaceterrace
text: They are consistent, reliable, helpful and 'Right on time!'

resp.text: peaceterrace, we're so glad to see you had a great experience with us! We can't wait to serve you again soon!

name: Zdenek Hel
text: Unfortunately, I found the store useless. I have a package scheduled for UPS pickup, however, they have not reached me at my home address. I tried to leave the package at this UPS store, a very logical course of action, I would argue. They refused to accept the package scheduled for pickup by their own company!! The staff was not helpful.

resp.text: We're sorry about the mix-up. As our employees expressed to you in-store, The UPS Store locations are not owned or operated by the United Parcel Service. As such, we are unable to accept unlabeled​ packages that are intended for UPS pickup, as that is a service which that company offers. We again apologize for any distress this caused you, and we'd be more than happy to help you contact the correct people in regards to your complaint against UPS.

name: Trevis Coleman
text: they are so awesome go see Chris and Blake for all your printing needs they are freaking awesome

name: Robert Humm

Ruthann,

name: Bo Time
text: Not a real UPS store, you cannot use accounts to ship from here. Store is not marked as an affiliate  but is. Staff Is discourteous.

resp.text:
Mr. Time,

This incident seems to arise from a fundamental misunderstanding about how the UPS Corporate umbrella works. Every single The UPS Store location is an individual franchise operating under The UPS Store, Inc. brand, a brand that is a wholly owned subsidiary of the United Parcel Service. We are not 'affiliates,' we are a child company that is both wholly owned and legally distinct from UPS, Inc. As such, we are required to follow UPS corporate policy as well as The UPS Store Corporate policy. This is not unique to ours or any other The UPS Store location.

UPS requires all UPS Customer Centers and The UPS Store locations to maintain their own 'Third Party Account' (also known as a UPS Shipping Account) and does not allow for any entity with a Shipping Account to ship using another entity's account number.

We, as The UPS Store Southside, would love to be able to accept these account numbers for payment, but we are explicitly forbidden from doing so. We do, however, apologize for the inconvenience this caused you. As you'll recall, when you came in on Friday, November 3rd at around 2pm, our associate did attempt to explain this to you. While we understand better than most just how confusing and frustrating some UPS regulations and policies can be, especially from the outside-looking-in, we feel that describing our staff as discourteous is, at the very least, misleading.

We hope this adequately resolves any lingering confusion, and if that's not the case, we invite you to reach out to us for further clarification.

Thanks!
~Management

name: Daphne Groce
text: Not on point with customer service!

resp.text:
Hi Daphne, we apologize that your service wasn't 100% satisfactory. If you wouldn't mind emailing the store (Store4088@TheUpsStore.com) with a detailed account of what you experienced, we'll be happy to sort out the issue!

Thank you! -Management

name: Beatrice M Reynolds
text: The customer service was awful, went in to have documents notarized and the notary left me sitting at the table for 20 minutes. I had to asked another representative where he went and he stated he went to the restroom. I sat, and sat, and sat.

resp.text: We're sorry that you had to wait for our notary, who at the time was battling an illness that required frequent restroom visits. We understand waiting on medical issues can be frustrating, but unfortunately, that was simply the only option available, as the Notary Public position is not available to all staff, and as such, they were the only one on duty that day. However, please note that the Notary Public did, in fact, inform you of the issue when you were seated, and as such you were not left unattended. You were simply served in as timely of a manner as possible, given the circumstances.

name: Amulya Reddy
text: Very helpful staff

resp.text: Glad to help. Please come back and visit

name: Pam Bailey
text: Yes I hope you’re having a great day!!! Time is very good 😌 and I like your girl so sweet precious,Thanks so much 😊

name: T Culpepper
text: Please be aware there is an employee theft ring at this location. I tried to mail two samsung phones from this location to my nephews. The phones were stolen and sold on the street. I should have known better to wrap the phones first before mailing. I had an insurance policy and UPS had the nerve to cut me a check, which I have yet to receive, for 143.00. The policy was valued at 300.00. I was told that it's being mailed to me so they say which makes no sense. It should have been over nighted for my inconvenience and experience. Its ups for goodness sakes. I've been on the phone for several hours being transferred to different department  only to find out that my claim was incorrectly entered as damaged property when in fact my property were stolen. The store manager Holly was less than helpful and acted like she didn't want to be bothered. She was initially rude to me when I returned to the store and acted like she didn't want to tell the claims process (We will call you back). All this took place before thanksgiving and it's now almost Christmas. My nephews will not have their gift on time and I have purchase the phones all over again. Please don't not go to this store to mail they will steal your merchandise.

name: Princess Creative Productions LLC
text: This location has been my goto for printing since 2017! I am a graphic designer and no matter what I throw their way they do a great job and get it done on time. Their staff is always professional. If you need their services check out this location they are excellent.

name: Paul E. McGowan
text: This is my absolute favorite UPS Store to use. Rodney & Royal are always so kind, courteous, fast, & professional! The store is in a convenient location in a strip mall adjacent to a N Walmart. Pretty easy to get in and out because there is a stoplight intersection on University and a turning lane on Cottage Hill.

name: CeCe Compton
text:
Was here at 8am when the store was SUPPOSED to be open. Not a single person was here and the store was locked. Waited for 25 minutes before the employee showed up. AND it was pouring rain!
The employee was very nice and helpful though, so that’s the only reason I’m giving the 2 stars instead of 1.

resp.text: We are sorry for the delay in opening.  As you stated, it was pouring raining.  Due to the weather, this employee had to take an alternate route and wound up stuck in traffic.  We appreciate your concern.

name: Bren Carpenter
text: Always very helpful, professional and courteous.

name: Daisha Peppins
text: I’ve visited this location three times and two out of the three weren’t good. The first one was great the guys were extremely helpful. But the other two times were awful due to the poor customer service I received by the lady at the counter. She seem like she didn’t want to be at work. I mean I understand, who wants to be at work on or before the holidays but come on now fake it until you make it. I work in customer service so I how how it feels but that attitude isn’t it. Especially the attitude she had the third time I came in asking for assistance. Her remarks were “oh lord and oh my gosh, that’s too much” huffing and puffing as if I was asking her to do some real work. I just got a few labels missed up with the package it went to. I know sometimes we may have a bad day but not every visit when you are working it’s not pleasant.

resp.text:
My name is Kyle. I'm the owner of the store in question.  I'm shocked at the service you received.  Would you be so kind as to tell me the date and approximate time you were in my store.  I'd like to review the tapes and correct the offending employee.  I can be reached at 251-259-0205.  I value your business and will resolve this issue.

Thank you,

Kyle

name: Connie Shebs
text: Just dropped in to return a package to Amazon. Young lady working was a dream! (Should have gotten her name.) She greeted me with a smile, scanned my return code, assured me that was all she needed and handed me a receipt. Did I mention my package wasn't sealed and I was prepared to purchase things to send it? 5 stars!

name: Sasha Parrish
text:
Jamie is Awesome!!! Very helpful and exceptional customer service!!! Keep up the
good work.

name: Kristen Dawson
text: Super friendly, helpful staff. It's always a pleasure to come in and pick up my mail.

name: Kyle Moffett
text: Found out that a family emergency caused them to open 30 minutes late.  Perfectly okay because these guys rock!

name: alaina moore
text: Store nothing but a rip off.  Go somewhere else. Prices are ludicrous. $2 to print one piece of paper

resp.text: Our current prices are $.49 for a color copy and less for a black and white copy.  It sounds like you rented our computer and had to pay for that rental time in addition to the copy you made.

name: John Schotta
text: The people that work there are extremely nice and very helpful.

resp.text:
Hi John,

Thank you so much for the kind words. I am so glad to hear that my employees did a great job of taking care of you. We look forward to seeing you soon!!

name: John Czerepak
text: Store is supposed to open at 8am. Went there on Wednesday June 21, 2018 at 8:25 am and it was locked up tight with nobody around.

resp.text:
Hi John,

Due to an issue beyond our control we were forced to open about 45 minutes late. We apologize for the inconvenience this caused you.

name: Londa S.
text: The best shipping company

resp.text: Thank you Londa we hope you continue to use us for your shipping needs.

name: Jesse D. Yancy

name: Aly Lyn
text: Great Customer Service!!!

name: Aalyia Shaukat
text: This ups store is now my favorites to go to. I've gotten the best customer service from Nikki. Shes always smiling and polite!

name: Regina Barnhill
text: Dropped of an important document to be mailed last Tuesday 6/8. Called my insurance company today to find out the package has never been scanned. Don't use this store if your shipment is important.

name: Raven T
text: I had to ship somethings to my mother out of state, and the associate Autumn help me with picking the right size box and ensuring that my items were well packaged and handled with care. She was so kind and friendly! I will definitely be back!

resp.text: Thank you Raven for your review! We are here for you anytime! Please come and see us anytimea and we wil be more than happy to help! Have a great weekend!

name: Alabama Bayou CC
text: Good service but they really need to stay open until 3:00PM on Saturday.  It would greatly help those who live in South West Mobile,  County.

name: Lauren Dyson
text: So, we are in the middle of a pandemic, and the chick at the front desk gives me attitude for asking her to put her mask on. Grab my stuff and tell her I'm going to another store and reporting her and suddenly she cares enough to put her mask on. I'm a chemo patient. IN THE MIDDLE OF A PANDEMIC. Don't go here. They do not care about customers and have an attitude when you ask them to follow the STATEWIDE mask mandate. Cool, cool. I'll take my business somewhere else!

name: Paul Cenac, MD
text:
As an Over The Road Trucker, like many people who work long days, it is a great thing to be able to have packages (as well as all mail) accepted, signed for, and safely stored for convenient pickup without worrying about Porch Pirates!
It was also great to establish a mailing address before moving to Mobile, and having a stable address until I finally bought my 'Forever/Die In' House!

name: Terri Roberts
text: My son bought a steering wheel cover from Amazon that was too small for his steering wheel.  It had come in a plastic UPS envelope.   When he took it and the return label to this UPS store, the clerk, Melissa, without even checking, told him it would not fit in the plastic envelope that he would have to buy a box.  SHE CHARGED HIM OVER $13.00 for the box to mail the $17.00 steering wheel cover.  He questioned the price but she insisted it was correct.  He later pulled the receipt from his wallet and discovered she charged him for the box and 2 separate packing charges.  He went back a few days later and they refused to refund anything to him.  Melissa purposely upsold him on this box and packing charges.  We will never use this store again.

name: Xena Wild
text: Fast and everyone had masks on and maintained distance.  Courteous and friendly unlike the last visit to this UPS..

name: Amber Carr
text: The two ladies that assisted me were very nice and helpful!

resp.text: Thank you Amber for the review. Please come back and see us anytime and we will be more than happy to assist you! Have a great weekend!

name: R M
text: They always help me out with my Amazon returns and take care of it for me

name: Ultreya Park
text: Website says call to verify notary services. I've called twice and no answer. It rings to a message that says "enter your remote access code." Also, needing to be verified during the time of the pandemic, is how they are handling services for the elderly at-risk population! You can't just be bandying these people about to drop in on places in find out the things you should be able to find out over the phone. I read some reviews on here that said they were thumbs down on customer service but they had improved. If you can't answer your phone, that is not a good sign!

name: Skye Martin
text: The gentleman that helped me today was total awesome.. He helped from  explaining  shipping to random questions.  He carefully packed my framed picture in a custom box and provided better ideas for the box. I would go back to work with him again.  Thanks again for the help..

name: Amber Pond
text: This place was terrible when we went here a year ago. I went in again recently out of desperation. The line was huge but moved quickly, the lady at the counter was friendly and knowledgeable. I'm so glad it's not the two men that were in here before. I'm glad I can use this UPS store now.

name: Michael Shavers
text: I have to commend and applaud the complete turn around I've noticed from this UPS store location. Being under new management, the staff has made my experiences with this store nothing but pleasant. The level of professionalism and knowledge they now posess really make you, the customer, feel as if you are the only customer.  Kudos to the overhaul. I definitely will continue to do all my shipping with them from now on.

name: Judith Rudel
text:
I needed a package sent off from Amazon. But for this particular package they sent me the label to print. I don’t have a printer so I figured I’d pay a couple of cents to pay for the label to print at this UPS. The employee said it would $7.10 to print my label. I said really.. $7 dollars for a price of paper. So I went across the street to Office Depot to print my label it was a whopping .17 cents. Came back to UPS and now he wanted to charge me to tape my box and the label to it. He said I could buy tape from him and do it myself.  And if I would have paid them to print my label he would have done it complimentary.
SAFE to say I will be using I different location. I have never been to UPS that has treated me this poorly. They are always more than happy to spare a few feet of tape to wrap up my packages. Not to mention Amazon packages. That company brings them so much money it’s unreal. Yet they can’t simply tape a box complimentary.

name: Ashley Coleman
text: I was reluctant to go to this store at first because of all the bad reviews but when I got there, I was very happy with my decision. Every staff member that was there was very pleasant and professional. They all were very knowledgeable and friendly. I asked about the bad reviews and they told me that they are now under new management. I would definitely recommend this store and I will being doing business with them again.

name: Brandie Mclean
text: I’m eight months pregnant I’ve been to this location three times to return the same Amazon package and three times they’ve given me a different reason why they can’t return it. First it was the label even though I have had no problem in the past year and a half of returning Amazon packages. Then it was the tape. They tape the box for the guy behind me but won’t tape the box for me. None of the guys in this Officer friendly every time I get one of them they are rude and condescending. Every time I get one of the females they’re super nice and friendly.

name: james griffin
text: All of the associates at this location has helped me so much with all of my personal and business shipping needs that I don't deal with any other UPS location. The only exception to this rule I have to due to my location at the time I need something shipped or need shipping supplies for a later shipment date..  This is also the only location that is close to my home and business.

resp.text: Thank You James! Please come back and see us anytime. We are here for all your business needs! Have a great weekend!

name: Veronica Kott
text: First: The delivery driver threw my package on to the porch. Second: He left as fast as he could for what reason I couldn't say but not professional at all. Third: He didn't look or care where he delivered it to. It was thrown at a neighbors home. In fact, this is the second time this has been done. I have to say is thank goodness for nice neighbors and UPS should rethink their hiring policies.

name: Nancy Phelps
text: My second time at this store, staff very friendly. Also found out they are under new management. Definitely recommend this store.

name: Joel Lee
text: Walked in to get 2 pages printed, which I do from time to time at different locations. They told me it would cost $7.00 to do this. I said no thanks. Across street at Office Depot it was .34. Why does this location charge so much compared to their other locations?

name: Robyn Brackin
text: The details should actually say “closes at 5:50” instead of 6:00.  We went to this location at 10 till 6 with our items and the door was locked.  When the gentleman came to the door he informed us he had already “shut down his computer and to come back tomorrow at 7:30am”.   I told him I was leaving for Atlanta earlier than that and had googled what time this store closed before making the trip here today.   Didn’t matter.    Computer was closed.  I informed him of the time but like I said - it didn’t matter.    Will not use this location again.

name: Angela Serigny
text: The first experience I had at this UPS store was good however everything since the initial visit has been a long process with the main UPS Company denying my partial refund claim. I received a call today and they told me that I was going to receive a partial refund directly from the manager of this store because of what happened and that he only wanted to keep his customers happy. Now that's how you do good business, a special thanks to him.

name: Mark Scheffler
text: I needed some documents printed so I could sign and fax back to Texas. Both employees stepped up to assist me with the printing and faxing and I was in and out in 20 minutes. I’ll use this location, again!!

name: Cody H
text:
I used to use this store anytime I could due to its location and the capacities it presents itself to have, however, my last few visits will most likely be the last time I go.
Reasons being:
* Prices have gone up drastically compared to other shipping options around town.
* Service on Saturdays is very slow due to only having a single employee working.
*Computer systems seem to be running on a well-outdated Windows7 format and printing equipment was probably invented by Gutenberg.

The employees seem nice and are trying to hold things together, but they have seemed to be constantly overwhelmed during each of my last three visits. Word of advice to management/ owners: "Take care of your employees, and they'll be happy to take care of your customers." I would really love to see this store make a turnaround, but it's not something I'll be holding my breath for anytime in the near future.

name: Andrew Algaze
text:
STAY AWAY FROM THIS STORE!!!! THESE PEOPLE ARE SCAM ARTISTS.

I ship from UPS weekly and their associate Tina tried to charge me $65.00 for shipping that routinely costs me $20-$30. She was polite and friendly to me at first but then became rude and obstinate when I asked her why it was costing me so much to ship this package and lied to me when I challenged her on it. The only reason we settled on the $39.00 total is because I had to catch a flight from the airport. UPS stores are franchise owned and because the franchise itself is a scam many owners must turn to this tactic I get that they have to make money but it's no stretch to say that charging $10 for an 85¢ box is criminal. I'd love to think that the owner of this store would want to do something about this but he'll probably just give her a gold star on the wall.

name: Brandon Badon
text:
Attempted to drop off a package 10 minutes until 6pm (the closing time) the door was locked and the cage around the counter closed, I look at the time and at the closing time on the window and sure enough they had closed early. I looked through the window and the woman behind the counter shakes her head no. I show her that all labels are prepared and all she needed to do was scan the label and take the box, shakes her head no. I plead with the woman in gesture ,but still her and the 2 other employees staring at me from behind the counter were unwavering in there decision to leave me locked out in the cold rain. So here I am typing this in my car. 0 out of 5
12/13/19

name: John Roberson
text: Make the extra drive to the Old Shell location. They will go out of their way to assist you.

name: shelly fortner
text: Horrible customer service. Rude and lazy employees. Id advise folks to use a different location. These people are awful.

name: xtianne18
text:
My package, which contained essential medications, arrived a week late despite paying over $200 for the UPS Express Service (2-day shipment). I have requested for a refund on the service itself, and 1 of the staff promised that a check with the appropriate refund should arrive in our mail. Sad to say, it's been over 2 months and we have never received a check from the party. I've asked my sister to follow up on my behalf (since I am living in Canada) and she went there almost every other week. I've been calling as well, but nobody answers the phone.

I am just disappointed.

name: T-N-TByTracia !!
text:
Very rude and unprofessional staff.
I do not recommend this location

name: Ryan Goggans
text:
Just went in to ship an item. The "lady" working, when confronted with something she was unfamiliar with, was extremely rude, condescending, and confrontational. I was humiliated in front of other customers because this woman didn't know her job and was unwilling to look into the issue further - shipping via Mercari.
She used phrases such as "uh, not happening"; the "owner only has a few franchises so you need to go to a corporate location"; after scanning the code from Mercari giving her instructions "I've never seen this before. Not happening. Don't know what to tell you. You need to go somewhere else."

DISGUSTING display of "customer service". I seriously felt almost scolded by bringing something to her that she didn't know how to do. This happened at roughly 12:15 on Saturday, April 13th, 2019. Hopefully the owner will see this and take action against this employee. She seems to think that by knowing the owner she's exempt from basic human kindness, never mind customer service. I should NEVER leave a business that I'm willing to give money to feeling the way I did today.
I HAVE had great experiences at this location, however. It all depends on the employee. And quite obviously, today's employee needs to be away from people. I understand everyone has bad days, but her behavior is still inexcusable. She was relentless in shutting me down and getting me out of the store because she got flustered about not knowing what to do.

name: Ecko Udezeh
text: i had my friend ship my package to me from Alabama to an APO address for armed forces Europe, first they overcharged her according to USPS it was 114 but UPS charged me 230. Second, they didn't fill out the paperwork correctly so now we don't even know where the package is. UPS says USPS picked it up but the tracking says they have yet to pick it up. USPS says they have not gotten the package, so basically my 150 gift is lost for my daughter for Christmas and i'm out 230 dollars for shipping. I would never use them to ship and I will not give up on getting my refund and my product replaced. Corporate has been called and trust and believed I will keep going up the chain until its fixed

name: Frankie Price
text: Had a drop--off. Was greeted when I entered and treated very well. The manager noticed a lady had a FedEx shipping label, he politely made her aware of it, keeping her from waiting in line. Plus provided directions to their location.

name: Raechel Rodriguez
text:
I went to this UPS location to mail a package to Germany,  the lady in there wasn't very helpful she almost didn't make me pay it was a good thing I asked for a tracking number and then she realized that I never paid for the package, she acted like she was on drugs..
fast forward $230.00 and 7 days later the package is considered lost, according to UPS it was picked up, according to USPS it was not, so when I called to speak to the manager that helped me, they told me she had gotten fired, ( in a matter of 7 days) the " Brandy" woman had NO idea how to help me, put me on hold 5 times for over 10 minutes each time, swore on the phone, and was ill mannered. then finally after getting through to "Randy" he assured me the package was not in there. except before they were so busy they couldn't look. then magically, they looked and didn't find it, so basically now i'm out 230$ my friends kids not getting her Christmas present, shes out $150 on the gift, and there is a lost hoover board some where floating around in thin air..

I would suggest  if your shipping anything that is expensive or want it delivered on time, not to go here. they are unprofessional, rude, and unorganized.

name: Tracy Johnson
text: The service is great however the shipping prices  are high. USPS is alot cheaper.

name: Jennifer Loden
text: Didn't  have my stuff ready after dropping it 5 hours earlier, then the machine broke and it wasn't complete. Now I have to go to FedEx anyway. Wasted trip all around. Did get 30% off my order given back but sometimes that doesn't always make things right. People usually take stuff there that is important and it would be great if it were treated that way.

name: ashley hoven
text: I think that it is great that this location opens at 7:30am

name: thesalesteamllc
text: Terrible people.  They quoted myvhusband 45.00 then  charged my husband for the highest amount possible to ship a package that usually takes 1 to 2 days anyway.  (92.00) When i went to pick package up and ship it alternatively 15 minutes later... the manager said it was already gone and they couldnt give me my package back and the driver wouldnt bring it back.  They deserve a ZERO rating for being crooks and poor customer service.

name: It's Us!
text: Called and verified that they have a notary at this location. Drove 45 miles, met with a person whom needed to sign an adoption consent for a child we are adopting.  Was told by the young girl working that the "notary was busy loading a truck, but would be available tomorrow".  When asked if the notary could spare 3 minutes, was told no.   So much for The UPS Store being there when really needed.

name: Carley Pekelder
text: Will never go back. Wasted $40 on 2nd day delivery for perishable goods when they put SIGNATURE REQUIRED on the package and they didn't at least let me know so I could notify the recipient. Cookies ruined, father's day ruined, $40 gone. And this is the second time this has happened!

name: Heidi B
text: Friendly and helpful staff!

name: IVIr Demon
text: Dropped off a package an was told I couldn't get a receipt

name: Clifford Robinson
text:
Seven dollars to print a label
I got charge $14 for a service

name: Sonya Roman
text: Great service very pleasant people.

name: Martha Dees
text: Great people ready to help in any capacity!!!

name: Gina Dickens
text: Very rude people!

name: Ricky Truong
text: These guys just lock the door in front of my face 2 mins before closing time.

resp.text: Dear Mr. Truong: First, We appreciate your time, feedback, concerns as well as your business. Our policy is to be Open from 8:00 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Monday through Fridays and Saturdays 9:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. Our Computers shut down promptly at 6:30 during the week. The issue you have raised is being reviewed via our In-house 24 Hr Video Camera System plus through our Electronic Door Locking Timing System which also tracks our closure times. We will address our closures times again with all Staff to ensure we abide by our posted closing times. We apologize for any inconvenience(s) you have encountered and look forward to seeing you in the future. Most Sincerely, Jim Rice, Manager.

name: Lynn Wickman
text: Never answer their phone. Shipping prices are insanely high.

name: Bill Campbell
text: NO NOTARY AS ADVERTISED. They don’t send to be good. Not so much under new management. did I mention NO NOTARY?

name: tony vanzant
text: always very helpful,

name: Kenny Hunter
text: Very rude when asking a question

resp.text: Dear Mr. Hunter: First we apologize that you feel that you and your question was not properly addressed or answered in a positive response or manner. In this fast-paced environment where customers rush in and want to conduct their business and be on their way as soon as practical, it may seem that less time is spent on a particular issue. Regardless though please know that your needs are very important to us. Now there have been times where a Customer may come in and unintentionally speak out and over other customers while Staff members are already working directly with the customer in front of them so then a speedy response by the Staff to a question may seem short, but our goal is always to provide the information that you may need. To provide a Positive Customer Service Experience is why we train and what we always strive to provide. Again, we appreciate your business and look forward to seeing you again. I will also be glad to personally discuss this further with you at any time. Most Sincerely, Jim Rice, Manager.

name: Evelyn Ellzey
text: Excellent service!!

name: Roberta Goins
text: I had some packages there to pickup the lady in there was sweet and got my packages for me. I am thankful I have some place close toy home that can keep packages and hold them till I go pick them up that way no one can steal them off of my porch if I am gone. Thank you UPS Store

name: James “XDMAN” Nicholas
text: If I absolutely need office supplies right now and cant order them online I will go here. The place is usually quite and empty for the most part so it is easy to get help from any of the employees. A plus is that they can make custom stamps for say and address while you wait.

name: Bryan Thompson
text: I tried sending a package through them and an employee was taking up the space for personal use on what appeared to be company time. I then showed them the QR code that they're supposed to be able to scan to print out a label. They didn't even know how to do that. The box I had needed to be taped so I asked if they could tape it. Not only did the employee only put a single, small piece of tape on it, but he didn't even know how to use the tape gun. I had to do it. Being the only person in line, it took me 15 minutes to get a label printed and box taped up.

name: Ashley Robinson
text: BOO! Equipment was all broken and employees didn't care. I waited FOREVER for my VERY important fax to send. When it finally failed they just shrugged and laughed. I had to leave. Signs were posted everywhere about malfuctioning equipment...it seems disfunction is the norm there. Boo.

name: Casey Sugden
text: The store is stocked full of all your office, school, and home essentials. Had no problem finding what I needed at good prices. Office Depot has a great inventory and a staff that is willing to help.

name: jennifer kyle
text: Great . Wonderful people work there. Best service.

name: Shelley Potter
text: I have done 2 different print orders there, and I will likely not go there again for a print order. Both times the order was marked as complete, and when I arrived I had to wait on them to fix it because there were mistakes.

name: Tarrie Love
text: Their staff is the best. I had designed an invitation, and was having trouble locating an envelope that would fit. I was despondent, thinking I would have to redesign the invitation, when a staff member asked if he could help. They sold me some envelopes out of the print shop inventory, and saved me tons of work!

name: Junion Pintal
text: It's an Office Depot, at the time of this posting it has some decent back to school sales going on. Otherwise it has a pretty normal selection of office supplies and equipment as well as printing facilities.

name: Mary Sumrall
text: Good service and great food!  Yummy cheese biscuits just can't get any better.

name: Mick McMeme
text: well stocked, just don't be in any sort of rush to get out quickly.

name: Bryan Taylor
text: Staff is always very helpful and often will stop to assist.

name: Nickie Dimartino
text: Has what I need most of the time. Prices are just a little higher than other options.

name: Caitlin Bonilla

name: Megan W
text:
I recently brought in a bunch of Amazon returns for processing, and the manager Flin completed the transactions very quickly and then went above and beyond to prevent me from making a mistake that would have necessitated a second trip to the store and generally ruined my day.

Aside from that great experience last week, all of my other interactions with this store have also been quick and easy. I definitely recommend this place. The only negative about it is that the location is often surrounded by dense traffic and never ending construction. I will continue to do my business here despite that slight inconvenience; the competent and efficient customer service is worth it.

name: Alexander Marbut
text: I'd be weary that the positive reviews here are coming from in-store. I've always been a big fan of online shopping, and before moving to Tuscaloosa I had all my packages delivered by UPS with no problems. Since moving here, every single item I have ordered has come with some problem or other. Every package looks like they were playing football with it behind the store before delivering. I had a high end TV delivered with the screen shattered right out of the box. I actually returned that one, relabelled it, and marked through all old labels with black sharpie--and they delivered it back to my door the next day, drenched in rain. I had to take off work twice to return the same item. Now they won't even deliver to my address--they see I live in a gated apartment, give up, and drop my packages off to be picked up at stores all over Tuscaloosa (CVS, Michaels). So now, every order, I have to spend hours trying to track down where they left my package. The order I picked up today from Michaels was mislabelled, so instead of a tablet I got an Apple TV that I now have to take off work (again) to return. I'm done taking off work to fix their mistakes--I will be paying extra money from now on if I have to just to use another delivery service.
